contentJson: ["There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job. And this man was blameless and upright, fearing God and shunning evil."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job. And this man was blameless and upright, fearing God and shunning evil.

contentJson: ["He had seven sons and three daughters,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He had seven sons and three daughters,

contentJson: ["and he owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 yoke of oxen, 500 female donkeys, and a very large number of servants. Job was the greatest man of all the people of the East."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: and he owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 yoke of oxen, 500 female donkeys, and a very large number of servants. Job was the greatest man of all the people of the East.

contentJson: ["Job’s sons would take turns holding feasts in their homes, and they would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Job’s sons would take turns holding feasts in their homes, and they would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.

contentJson: ["And when the days of feasting were over, Job would send for his children to purify them, rising early in the morning to offer burnt offerings for all of them. For Job thought, “Perhaps my children have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” This was Job’s regular practice."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And when the days of feasting were over, Job would send for his children to purify them, rising early in the morning to offer burnt offerings for all of them. For Job thought, “Perhaps my children have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.” This was Job’s regular practice.

contentJson: ["One day the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan",{"noteId":0},"also came with them."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: One day the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan also came with them.

contentJson: ["“Where have you come from?” said the LORD to Satan.",{"lineBreak":true},"“From roaming through the earth,” he replied, “and walking back and forth in it.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“Where have you come from?” said the LORD to Satan. 
“From roaming through the earth,” he replied, “and walking back and forth in it.”

contentJson: ["Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one on earth like him, a man who is blameless and upright, who fears God and shuns evil.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one on earth like him, a man who is blameless and upright, who fears God and shuns evil.”

contentJson: ["Satan answered the LORD, “Does Job fear God for nothing?"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Satan answered the LORD, “Does Job fear God for nothing?

contentJson: ["Have You not placed a hedge on every side around him and his household and all that he owns? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his possessions have increased in the land."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Have You not placed a hedge on every side around him and his household and all that he owns? You have blessed the work of his hands, and his possessions have increased in the land.

contentJson: ["But stretch out Your hand and strike all that he has, and he will surely curse You to Your face.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But stretch out Your hand and strike all that he has, and he will surely curse You to Your face.”

contentJson: ["“Very well,” said the LORD to Satan. “Everything he has is in your hands, but you must not lay a hand on the man himself.”",{"lineBreak":true},"Then Satan went out from the presence of the LORD."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“Very well,” said the LORD to Satan. “Everything he has is in your hands, but you must not lay a hand on the man himself.” 
Then Satan went out from the presence of the LORD.

contentJson: ["One day, while Job’s sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: One day, while Job’s sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,

contentJson: ["a messenger came and reported to Job: “While the oxen were plowing and the donkeys were grazing nearby,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: a messenger came and reported to Job: “While the oxen were plowing and the donkeys were grazing nearby,

contentJson: ["the Sabeans swooped down and took them away. They put the servants to the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the Sabeans swooped down and took them away. They put the servants to the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”

contentJson: ["While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “The fire of God fell from heaven. It burned and consumed the sheep and the servants, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “The fire of God fell from heaven. It burned and consumed the sheep and the servants, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”

contentJson: ["While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “The Chaldeans formed three bands, raided the camels, and took them away. They put the servants to the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “The Chaldeans formed three bands, raided the camels, and took them away. They put the servants to the sword, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”

contentJson: ["While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: While he was still speaking, another messenger came and reported: “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in their oldest brother’s house,

contentJson: ["when suddenly a mighty wind swept in from the desert and struck the four corners of the house. It collapsed on the young people and they are dead, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when suddenly a mighty wind swept in from the desert and struck the four corners of the house. It collapsed on the young people and they are dead, and I alone have escaped to tell you!”

contentJson: ["Then Job stood up, tore his robe, and shaved his head. He fell to the ground and worshiped,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job stood up, tore his robe, and shaved his head. He fell to the ground and worshiped,

contentJson: ["saying:",{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"“Naked I came from my mother’s womb,","poem":1},{"text":"and naked I will return.","poem":2},{"text":"The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away.","poem":1},{"text":"Blessed be the name of the LORD.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
saying: 
“Naked I came from my mother’s womb, and naked I will return. The LORD gave, and the LORD has taken away. Blessed be the name of the LORD.”

contentJson: ["In all this, Job did not sin or charge God with wrongdoing."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In all this, Job did not sin or charge God with wrongdoing.

contentJson: ["On another day the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan",{"noteId":1},"also came with them to present himself before Him."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: On another day the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan also came with them to present himself before Him.

contentJson: ["“Where have you come from?” said the LORD to Satan.",{"lineBreak":true},"“From roaming through the earth,” he replied, “and walking back and forth in it.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“Where have you come from?” said the LORD to Satan. 
“From roaming through the earth,” he replied, “and walking back and forth in it.”

contentJson: ["Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one on earth like him, a man who is blameless and upright, who fears God and shuns evil. He still retains his integrity, even though you incited Me against him to ruin him without cause.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered My servant Job? For there is no one on earth like him, a man who is blameless and upright, who fears God and shuns evil. He still retains his integrity, even though you incited Me against him to ruin him without cause.”

contentJson: ["“Skin for skin!” Satan replied. “A man will give up all he owns in exchange for his life."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Skin for skin!” Satan replied. “A man will give up all he owns in exchange for his life.

contentJson: ["But stretch out Your hand and strike his flesh and bones, and he will surely curse You to Your face.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But stretch out Your hand and strike his flesh and bones, and he will surely curse You to Your face.”

contentJson: ["“Very well,” said the LORD to Satan. “He is in your hands, but you must spare his life.”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Very well,” said the LORD to Satan. “He is in your hands, but you must spare his life.”

contentJson: ["So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD and infected Job with terrible boils from the soles of his feet to the crown of his head."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So Satan went out from the presence of the LORD and infected Job with terrible boils from the soles of his feet to the crown of his head.

contentJson: ["And Job took a piece of broken pottery to scrape himself as he sat among the ashes."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And Job took a piece of broken pottery to scrape himself as he sat among the ashes.

contentJson: ["Then Job’s wife said to him, “Do you still retain your integrity? Curse",{"noteId":2},"God and die!”"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job’s wife said to him, “Do you still retain your integrity? Curse God and die!”

contentJson: ["“You speak as a foolish woman speaks,” he told her. “Should we accept from God only good and not adversity?”",{"lineBreak":true},"In all this, Job did not sin in what he said."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“You speak as a foolish woman speaks,” he told her. “Should we accept from God only good and not adversity?” 
In all this, Job did not sin in what he said.

contentJson: ["Now when Job’s three friends—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite—heard about all this adversity that had come upon him, each of them came from his home, and they met together to go and sympathize with Job and comfort him."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Now when Job’s three friends—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite—heard about all this adversity that had come upon him, each of them came from his home, and they met together to go and sympathize with Job and comfort him.

contentJson: ["When they lifted up their eyes from afar, they could barely recognize Job. They began to weep aloud, and each man tore his robe and threw dust in the air over his head."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When they lifted up their eyes from afar, they could barely recognize Job. They began to weep aloud, and each man tore his robe and threw dust in the air over his head.

contentJson: ["Then they sat on the ground with him for seven days and seven nights, but no one spoke a word to him because they saw how intense his suffering was."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then they sat on the ground with him for seven days and seven nights, but no one spoke a word to him because they saw how intense his suffering was.

contentJson: ["After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: After this, Job opened his mouth and cursed the day of his birth.

contentJson: ["And this is what he said:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And this is what he said:

contentJson: [{"text":"“May the day of my birth perish,","poem":1},{"text":"and the night it was said,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"‘A boy is conceived.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“May the day of my birth perish, and the night it was said, 
‘A boy is conceived.’

contentJson: [{"text":"If only that day had turned to darkness!","poem":1},{"text":"May God above disregard it;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"may no light shine upon it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
If only that day had turned to darkness! May God above disregard it; 
may no light shine upon it.

contentJson: [{"text":"May darkness and gloom reclaim it,","poem":1},{"text":"and a cloud settle over it;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"may the blackness of the day overwhelm it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
May darkness and gloom reclaim it, and a cloud settle over it; 
may the blackness of the day overwhelm it.

contentJson: [{"text":"If only darkness had taken that night away!","poem":1},{"text":"May it not appear among the days of the year;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"may it never be entered in any of the months.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
If only darkness had taken that night away! May it not appear among the days of the year; 
may it never be entered in any of the months.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, may that night be barren;","poem":1},{"text":"may no joyful voice come into it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, may that night be barren; may no joyful voice come into it.

contentJson: [{"text":"May it be cursed by those who curse the day","poem":1},{"noteId":3},{"text":"—","poem":1},{"text":"those prepared to rouse Leviathan.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: May it be cursed by those who curse the day — those prepared to rouse Leviathan.

contentJson: [{"text":"May its morning stars grow dark;","poem":1},{"text":"may it wait in vain for daylight;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"may it not see the breaking of dawn.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
May its morning stars grow dark; may it wait in vain for daylight; 
may it not see the breaking of dawn.

contentJson: [{"text":"For that night did not shut the doors of the womb","poem":1},{"text":"to hide the sorrow from my eyes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For that night did not shut the doors of the womb to hide the sorrow from my eyes.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why did I not perish at birth;","poem":1},{"text":"why did I not die as I came from the womb?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why did I not perish at birth; why did I not die as I came from the womb?

contentJson: [{"text":"Why were there knees to receive me,","poem":1},{"text":"and breasts that I should be nursed?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why were there knees to receive me, and breasts that I should be nursed?

contentJson: [{"text":"For now I would be lying down in peace;","poem":1},{"text":"I would be asleep and at rest","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For now I would be lying down in peace; I would be asleep and at rest

contentJson: [{"text":"with kings and counselors of the earth,","poem":1},{"text":"who built for themselves cities now in ruins,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: with kings and counselors of the earth, who built for themselves cities now in ruins,

contentJson: [{"text":"or with princes who had gold,","poem":1},{"text":"who filled their houses with silver.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: or with princes who had gold, who filled their houses with silver.

contentJson: [{"text":"Or why was I not hidden like a stillborn child,","poem":1},{"text":"like an infant who never sees daylight?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Or why was I not hidden like a stillborn child, like an infant who never sees daylight?

contentJson: [{"text":"There the wicked cease from raging,","poem":1},{"text":"and there the weary find rest.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: There the wicked cease from raging, and there the weary find rest.

contentJson: [{"text":"The captives enjoy their ease;","poem":1},{"text":"they do not hear the voice of the oppressor.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The captives enjoy their ease; they do not hear the voice of the oppressor.

contentJson: [{"text":"Both small and great are there,","poem":1},{"text":"and the slave is freed from his master.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Both small and great are there, and the slave is freed from his master.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why is light given to the miserable,","poem":1},{"text":"and life to the bitter of soul,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why is light given to the miserable, and life to the bitter of soul,

contentJson: [{"text":"who long for death that does not come,","poem":1},{"text":"and search for it like hidden treasure,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: who long for death that does not come, and search for it like hidden treasure,

contentJson: [{"text":"who rejoice and greatly exult","poem":1},{"text":"when they can find the grave?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: who rejoice and greatly exult when they can find the grave?

contentJson: [{"text":"Why is life given to a man whose way is hidden,","poem":1},{"text":"whom God has hedged in?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why is life given to a man whose way is hidden, whom God has hedged in?

contentJson: [{"text":"I sigh when food is put before me,","poem":1},{"text":"and my groans pour out like water.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I sigh when food is put before me, and my groans pour out like water.

contentJson: [{"text":"For the thing I feared has overtaken me,","poem":1},{"text":"and what I dreaded has befallen me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For the thing I feared has overtaken me, and what I dreaded has befallen me.

contentJson: [{"text":"I am not at ease or quiet;","poem":1},{"text":"I have no rest, for trouble has come.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I am not at ease or quiet; I have no rest, for trouble has come.”

contentJson: ["Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“If one ventures a word with you, will you be wearied?","poem":1},{"text":"Yet who can keep from speaking?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “If one ventures a word with you, will you be wearied? Yet who can keep from speaking?

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely you have instructed many,","poem":1},{"text":"and have strengthened their feeble hands.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely you have instructed many, and have strengthened their feeble hands.

contentJson: [{"text":"Your words have steadied those who stumbled;","poem":1},{"text":"you have braced the knees that were buckling.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your words have steadied those who stumbled; you have braced the knees that were buckling.

contentJson: [{"text":"But now trouble has come upon you, and you are weary.","poem":1},{"text":"It strikes you, and you are dismayed.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But now trouble has come upon you, and you are weary. It strikes you, and you are dismayed.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is your reverence not your confidence,","poem":1},{"text":"and the uprightness of your ways your hope?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is your reverence not your confidence, and the uprightness of your ways your hope?

contentJson: [{"text":"Consider now, I plead:","poem":1},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Who, being innocent, has ever perished?","poem":1},{"text":"Or where have the upright been destroyed?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Consider now, I plead: 
Who, being innocent, has ever perished? Or where have the upright been destroyed?

contentJson: [{"text":"As I have observed, those who plow iniquity","poem":1},{"text":"and those who sow trouble reap the same.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As I have observed, those who plow iniquity and those who sow trouble reap the same.

contentJson: [{"text":"By the breath of God they perish,","poem":1},{"text":"and by the blast of His anger they are consumed.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: By the breath of God they perish, and by the blast of His anger they are consumed.

contentJson: [{"text":"The lion may roar, and the fierce lion may growl,","poem":1},{"text":"yet the teeth of the young lions are broken.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The lion may roar, and the fierce lion may growl, yet the teeth of the young lions are broken.

contentJson: [{"text":"The old lion perishes for lack of prey,","poem":1},{"text":"and the cubs of the lioness are scattered.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The old lion perishes for lack of prey, and the cubs of the lioness are scattered.

contentJson: [{"text":"Now a word came to me secretly;","poem":1},{"text":"my ears caught a whisper of it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Now a word came to me secretly; my ears caught a whisper of it.

contentJson: [{"text":"In disquieting visions in the night,","poem":1},{"text":"when deep sleep falls on men,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In disquieting visions in the night, when deep sleep falls on men,

contentJson: [{"text":"fear and trembling came over me","poem":1},{"text":"and made all my bones shudder.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: fear and trembling came over me and made all my bones shudder.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then a spirit","poem":1},{"noteId":4},{"text":"glided past my face,","poem":1},{"text":"and the hair on my body bristled.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then a spirit glided past my face, and the hair on my body bristled.

contentJson: [{"text":"It stood still,","poem":1},{"text":"but I could not discern its appearance;","poem":2},{"text":"a form loomed before my eyes,","poem":1},{"text":"and I heard a whispering voice:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It stood still, but I could not discern its appearance; a form loomed before my eyes, and I heard a whispering voice:

contentJson: [{"text":"‘Can a mortal be more righteous than God,","poem":1},{"text":"or a man more pure than his Maker?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: ‘Can a mortal be more righteous than God, or a man more pure than his Maker?

contentJson: [{"text":"If God puts no trust in His servants,","poem":1},{"text":"and He charges His angels with error,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If God puts no trust in His servants, and He charges His angels with error,

contentJson: [{"text":"how much more those who dwell in houses of clay,","poem":1},{"text":"whose foundations are in the dust,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"who can be crushed like a moth!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
how much more those who dwell in houses of clay, whose foundations are in the dust, 
who can be crushed like a moth!

contentJson: [{"text":"They are smashed to pieces from dawn to dusk;","poem":1},{"text":"unnoticed, they perish forever.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They are smashed to pieces from dawn to dusk; unnoticed, they perish forever.

contentJson: [{"text":"Are not their tent cords pulled up,","poem":1},{"text":"so that they die without wisdom?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Are not their tent cords pulled up, so that they die without wisdom?’

contentJson: [{"text":"“Call out if you please, but who will answer?","poem":1},{"text":"To which of the holy ones will you turn?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Call out if you please, but who will answer? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

contentJson: [{"text":"For resentment kills a fool,","poem":1},{"text":"and envy slays the simple.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For resentment kills a fool, and envy slays the simple.

contentJson: [{"text":"I have seen a fool taking root,","poem":1},{"text":"but suddenly his house was cursed.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have seen a fool taking root, but suddenly his house was cursed.

contentJson: [{"text":"His sons are far from safety,","poem":1},{"text":"crushed in court without a defender.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His sons are far from safety, crushed in court without a defender.

contentJson: [{"text":"The hungry consume his harvest,","poem":1},{"text":"taking it even from the thorns,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and the thirsty pant after his wealth.","poem":2},{"noteId":5}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The hungry consume his harvest, taking it even from the thorns, 
and the thirsty pant after his wealth.

contentJson: [{"text":"For distress does not spring from the dust,","poem":1},{"text":"and trouble does not sprout from the ground.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For distress does not spring from the dust, and trouble does not sprout from the ground.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet man is born to trouble","poem":1},{"text":"as surely as sparks fly upward.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet man is born to trouble as surely as sparks fly upward.

contentJson: [{"text":"However, if I were you, I would appeal to God","poem":1},{"text":"and lay my cause before Him—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: However, if I were you, I would appeal to God and lay my cause before Him—

contentJson: [{"text":"the One who does great and unsearchable things,","poem":1},{"text":"wonders without number.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the One who does great and unsearchable things, wonders without number.

contentJson: [{"text":"He gives rain to the earth","poem":1},{"text":"and sends water upon the fields.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He gives rain to the earth and sends water upon the fields.

contentJson: [{"text":"He sets the lowly on high,","poem":1},{"text":"so that mourners are lifted to safety.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He sets the lowly on high, so that mourners are lifted to safety.

contentJson: [{"text":"He thwarts the schemes of the crafty,","poem":1},{"text":"so that their hands find no success.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He thwarts the schemes of the crafty, so that their hands find no success.

contentJson: [{"text":"He catches the wise in their craftiness,","poem":1},{"noteId":6},{"text":"and sweeps away the plans of the cunning.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He catches the wise in their craftiness, and sweeps away the plans of the cunning.

contentJson: [{"text":"They encounter darkness by day","poem":1},{"text":"and grope at noon as in the night.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They encounter darkness by day and grope at noon as in the night.

contentJson: [{"text":"He saves the needy from the sword in their mouth","poem":1},{"text":"and from the clutches of the powerful.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He saves the needy from the sword in their mouth and from the clutches of the powerful.

contentJson: [{"text":"So the poor have hope,","poem":1},{"text":"and injustice shuts its mouth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So the poor have hope, and injustice shuts its mouth.

contentJson: [{"text":"Blessed indeed is the man whom God corrects;","poem":1},{"text":"so do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.","poem":2},{"noteId":7}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Blessed indeed is the man whom God corrects; so do not despise the discipline of the Almighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"For He wounds, but He also binds;","poem":1},{"text":"He strikes, but His hands also heal.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For He wounds, but He also binds; He strikes, but His hands also heal.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will rescue you from six calamities;","poem":1},{"text":"no harm will touch you in seven.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will rescue you from six calamities; no harm will touch you in seven.

contentJson: [{"text":"In famine He will redeem you from death,","poem":1},{"text":"and in battle from the stroke of the sword.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In famine He will redeem you from death, and in battle from the stroke of the sword.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue,","poem":1},{"text":"and will not fear havoc when it comes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, and will not fear havoc when it comes.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will laugh at destruction and famine,","poem":1},{"text":"and need not fear the beasts of the earth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will laugh at destruction and famine, and need not fear the beasts of the earth.

contentJson: [{"text":"For you will have a covenant with the stones of the field,","poem":1},{"text":"and the wild animals will be at peace with you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For you will have a covenant with the stones of the field, and the wild animals will be at peace with you.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will know that your tent is secure,","poem":1},{"text":"and find nothing amiss when inspecting your home.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will know that your tent is secure, and find nothing amiss when inspecting your home.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will know that your offspring will be many,","poem":1},{"text":"your descendants like the grass of the earth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will know that your offspring will be many, your descendants like the grass of the earth.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will come to the grave in full vigor,","poem":1},{"text":"like a sheaf of grain gathered in season.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will come to the grave in full vigor, like a sheaf of grain gathered in season.

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, we have investigated, and it is true!","poem":1},{"text":"So hear it and know for yourself.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Indeed, we have investigated, and it is true! So hear it and know for yourself.”

contentJson: ["Then Job replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“If only my grief could be weighed","poem":1},{"text":"and placed with my calamity on the scales.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “If only my grief could be weighed and placed with my calamity on the scales.

contentJson: [{"text":"For then it would outweigh the sand of the seas—","poem":1},{"text":"no wonder my words have been rash.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For then it would outweigh the sand of the seas— no wonder my words have been rash.

contentJson: [{"text":"For the arrows of the Almighty have pierced me;","poem":1},{"text":"my spirit drinks in their poison;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"the terrors of God are arrayed against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
For the arrows of the Almighty have pierced me; my spirit drinks in their poison; 
the terrors of God are arrayed against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Does a wild donkey bray over fresh grass,","poem":1},{"text":"or an ox low over its fodder?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does a wild donkey bray over fresh grass, or an ox low over its fodder?

contentJson: [{"text":"Is tasteless food eaten without salt,","poem":1},{"text":"or is there flavor in the white of an egg","poem":2},{"noteId":8},{"text":"?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is tasteless food eaten without salt, or is there flavor in the white of an egg ?

contentJson: [{"text":"My soul refuses to touch them;","poem":1},{"text":"they are loathsome food to me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My soul refuses to touch them; they are loathsome food to me.

contentJson: [{"text":"If only my request were granted","poem":1},{"text":"and God would fulfill my hope:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If only my request were granted and God would fulfill my hope:

contentJson: [{"text":"that God would be willing to crush me,","poem":1},{"text":"to unleash His hand and cut me off!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: that God would be willing to crush me, to unleash His hand and cut me off!

contentJson: [{"text":"It still brings me comfort,","poem":1},{"text":"and joy through unrelenting pain,","poem":2},{"text":"that I have not denied","poem":1},{"text":"the words of the Holy One.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It still brings me comfort, and joy through unrelenting pain, that I have not denied the words of the Holy One.

contentJson: [{"text":"What strength do I have, that I should still hope?","poem":1},{"text":"What is my future, that I should be patient?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What strength do I have, that I should still hope? What is my future, that I should be patient?

contentJson: [{"text":"Is my strength like that of stone,","poem":1},{"text":"or my flesh made of bronze?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is my strength like that of stone, or my flesh made of bronze?

contentJson: [{"text":"Is there any help within me","poem":1},{"text":"now that success is driven from me?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is there any help within me now that success is driven from me?

contentJson: [{"text":"A despairing man should have the kindness of his friend,","poem":1},{"text":"even if he forsakes the fear of the Almighty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A despairing man should have the kindness of his friend, even if he forsakes the fear of the Almighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"But my brothers are as faithless as wadis,","poem":1},{"text":"as seasonal streams that overflow,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But my brothers are as faithless as wadis, as seasonal streams that overflow,

contentJson: [{"text":"darkened because of the ice","poem":1},{"text":"and the inflow of melting snow,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: darkened because of the ice and the inflow of melting snow,

contentJson: [{"text":"but ceasing in the dry season","poem":1},{"text":"and vanishing from their channels in the heat.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: but ceasing in the dry season and vanishing from their channels in the heat.

contentJson: [{"text":"Caravans turn aside from their routes;","poem":1},{"text":"they go into the wasteland and perish.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Caravans turn aside from their routes; they go into the wasteland and perish.

contentJson: [{"text":"The caravans of Tema look for water;","poem":1},{"text":"the travelers of Sheba hope to find it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The caravans of Tema look for water; the travelers of Sheba hope to find it.

contentJson: [{"text":"They are confounded because they had hoped;","poem":1},{"text":"their arrival brings disappointment.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They are confounded because they had hoped; their arrival brings disappointment.

contentJson: [{"text":"For now you are of no help;","poem":1},{"text":"you see terror, and you are afraid.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For now you are of no help; you see terror, and you are afraid.

contentJson: [{"text":"Have I ever said, ‘Give me something;","poem":1},{"text":"offer me a bribe from your wealth;","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Have I ever said, ‘Give me something; offer me a bribe from your wealth;

contentJson: [{"text":"deliver me from the hand of the enemy;","poem":1},{"text":"redeem me from the grasp of the ruthless’?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: deliver me from the hand of the enemy; redeem me from the grasp of the ruthless’?

contentJson: [{"text":"Teach me, and I will be silent.","poem":1},{"text":"Help me understand how I have erred.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Teach me, and I will be silent. Help me understand how I have erred.

contentJson: [{"text":"How painful are honest words!","poem":1},{"text":"But what does your argument prove?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How painful are honest words! But what does your argument prove?

contentJson: [{"text":"Do you intend to correct my words,","poem":1},{"text":"and treat as wind my cry of despair?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do you intend to correct my words, and treat as wind my cry of despair?

contentJson: [{"text":"You would even cast lots for an orphan","poem":1},{"text":"and barter away your friend.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You would even cast lots for an orphan and barter away your friend.

contentJson: [{"text":"But now, please look at me.","poem":1},{"text":"Would I lie to your face?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But now, please look at me. Would I lie to your face?

contentJson: [{"text":"Reconsider; do not be unjust.","poem":1},{"text":"Reconsider, for my righteousness is at stake.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Reconsider; do not be unjust. Reconsider, for my righteousness is at stake.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is there iniquity on my tongue?","poem":1},{"text":"Can my mouth not discern malice?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is there iniquity on my tongue? Can my mouth not discern malice?

contentJson: [{"text":"“Is not man consigned to labor on earth?","poem":1},{"text":"Are not his days like those of a hired hand?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Is not man consigned to labor on earth? Are not his days like those of a hired hand?

contentJson: [{"text":"Like a slave he longs for shade;","poem":1},{"text":"like a hireling he waits for his wages.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Like a slave he longs for shade; like a hireling he waits for his wages.

contentJson: [{"text":"So I am allotted months of futility,","poem":1},{"text":"and nights of misery are appointed me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So I am allotted months of futility, and nights of misery are appointed me.

contentJson: [{"text":"When I lie down I think:","poem":1},{"text":"‘When will I get up?’","poem":2},{"text":"But the night drags on,","poem":1},{"text":"and I toss and turn until dawn.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When I lie down I think: ‘When will I get up?’ But the night drags on, and I toss and turn until dawn.

contentJson: [{"text":"My flesh is clothed with worms","poem":1},{"text":"and encrusted with dirt;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"my skin is cracked and festering.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
My flesh is clothed with worms and encrusted with dirt; 
my skin is cracked and festering.

contentJson: [{"text":"My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle;","poem":1},{"text":"they come to an end without hope.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle; they come to an end without hope.

contentJson: [{"text":"Remember that my life is but a breath.","poem":1},{"text":"My eyes will never again see happiness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Remember that my life is but a breath. My eyes will never again see happiness.

contentJson: [{"text":"The eye that beholds me will no longer see me.","poem":1},{"text":"You will look for me, but I will be no more.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The eye that beholds me will no longer see me. You will look for me, but I will be no more.

contentJson: [{"text":"As a cloud vanishes and is gone,","poem":1},{"text":"so he who goes down to Sheol does not come back up.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As a cloud vanishes and is gone, so he who goes down to Sheol does not come back up.

contentJson: [{"text":"He never returns to his house;","poem":1},{"text":"his place remembers him no more.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He never returns to his house; his place remembers him no more.

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore I will not restrain my mouth;","poem":1},{"text":"I will speak in the anguish of my spirit;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Therefore I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; 
I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

contentJson: [{"text":"Am I the sea, or the monster of the deep,","poem":1},{"text":"that You must keep me under guard?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Am I the sea, or the monster of the deep, that You must keep me under guard?

contentJson: [{"text":"When I think my bed will comfort me","poem":1},{"text":"and my couch will ease my complaint,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When I think my bed will comfort me and my couch will ease my complaint,

contentJson: [{"text":"then You frighten me with dreams","poem":1},{"text":"and terrify me with visions,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then You frighten me with dreams and terrify me with visions,

contentJson: [{"text":"so that I would prefer strangling and death","poem":1},{"text":"over my life in this body.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: so that I would prefer strangling and death over my life in this body.

contentJson: [{"text":"I loathe my life! I would not live forever.","poem":1},{"text":"Leave me alone, for my days are but a breath.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I loathe my life! I would not live forever. Leave me alone, for my days are but a breath.

contentJson: [{"text":"What is man that You should exalt him,","poem":1},{"text":"that You should set Your heart upon him,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What is man that You should exalt him, that You should set Your heart upon him,

contentJson: [{"text":"that You attend to him every morning,","poem":1},{"text":"and test him every moment?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: that You attend to him every morning, and test him every moment?

contentJson: [{"text":"Will You never look away from me,","poem":1},{"text":"or leave me alone to swallow my spittle?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will You never look away from me, or leave me alone to swallow my spittle?

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have sinned, what have I done to You,","poem":1},{"text":"O watcher of mankind?","poem":2},{"text":"Why have You made me Your target,","poem":1},{"text":"so that I am a burden to You","poem":2},{"noteId":9},{"text":"?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have sinned, what have I done to You, O watcher of mankind? Why have You made me Your target, so that I am a burden to You ?

contentJson: [{"text":"Why do You not pardon my transgression","poem":1},{"text":"and take away my iniquity?","poem":2},{"text":"For soon I will lie down in the dust;","poem":1},{"text":"You will seek me, but I will be no more.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do You not pardon my transgression and take away my iniquity? For soon I will lie down in the dust; You will seek me, but I will be no more.”

contentJson: ["Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“How long will you go on saying such things?","poem":1},{"text":"The words of your mouth are a blustering wind.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “How long will you go on saying such things? The words of your mouth are a blustering wind.

contentJson: [{"text":"Does God pervert justice?","poem":1},{"text":"Does the Almighty pervert what is right?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does God pervert justice? Does the Almighty pervert what is right?

contentJson: [{"text":"When your children sinned against Him,","poem":1},{"text":"He gave them over to their rebellion.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When your children sinned against Him, He gave them over to their rebellion.

contentJson: [{"text":"But if you would earnestly seek God","poem":1},{"text":"and ask the Almighty for mercy,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But if you would earnestly seek God and ask the Almighty for mercy,

contentJson: [{"text":"if you are pure and upright,","poem":1},{"text":"even now He will rouse Himself on your behalf","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and restore your righteous estate.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
if you are pure and upright, even now He will rouse Himself on your behalf 
and restore your righteous estate.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though your beginnings were modest,","poem":1},{"text":"your latter days will flourish.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though your beginnings were modest, your latter days will flourish.

contentJson: [{"text":"Please inquire of past generations","poem":1},{"text":"and consider the discoveries of their fathers.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Please inquire of past generations and consider the discoveries of their fathers.

contentJson: [{"text":"For we were born yesterday and know nothing;","poem":1},{"text":"our days on earth are but a shadow.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For we were born yesterday and know nothing; our days on earth are but a shadow.

contentJson: [{"text":"Will they not teach you and tell you,","poem":1},{"text":"and speak from their understanding?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will they not teach you and tell you, and speak from their understanding?

contentJson: [{"text":"Does papyrus grow where there is no marsh?","poem":1},{"text":"Do reeds flourish without water?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does papyrus grow where there is no marsh? Do reeds flourish without water?

contentJson: [{"text":"While the shoots are still uncut,","poem":1},{"text":"they dry up quicker than grass.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: While the shoots are still uncut, they dry up quicker than grass.

contentJson: [{"text":"Such is the destiny of all who forget God;","poem":1},{"text":"so the hope of the godless will perish.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Such is the destiny of all who forget God; so the hope of the godless will perish.

contentJson: [{"text":"His confidence is fragile;","poem":1},{"text":"his security is in a spider’s web.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His confidence is fragile; his security is in a spider’s web.

contentJson: [{"text":"He leans on his web, but it gives way;","poem":1},{"text":"he holds fast, but it does not endure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He leans on his web, but it gives way; he holds fast, but it does not endure.

contentJson: [{"text":"He is a well-watered plant in the sunshine,","poem":1},{"text":"spreading its shoots over the garden.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He is a well-watered plant in the sunshine, spreading its shoots over the garden.

contentJson: [{"text":"His roots wrap around the rock heap;","poem":1},{"text":"he looks for a home among the stones.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His roots wrap around the rock heap; he looks for a home among the stones.

contentJson: [{"text":"If he is uprooted from his place,","poem":1},{"text":"it will disown him, saying, ‘I never saw you.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If he is uprooted from his place, it will disown him, saying, ‘I never saw you.’

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely this is the joy of his way;","poem":1},{"text":"yet others will spring from the dust.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely this is the joy of his way; yet others will spring from the dust.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, God does not reject the blameless,","poem":1},{"text":"nor will He strengthen the hand of evildoers.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, God does not reject the blameless, nor will He strengthen the hand of evildoers.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will yet fill your mouth with laughter,","poem":1},{"text":"and your lips with a shout of joy.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will yet fill your mouth with laughter, and your lips with a shout of joy.

contentJson: [{"text":"Your enemies will be clothed in shame,","poem":1},{"text":"and the tent of the wicked will be no more.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your enemies will be clothed in shame, and the tent of the wicked will be no more.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Yes, I know that it is so,","poem":1},{"text":"but how can a mortal be righteous before God?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Yes, I know that it is so, but how can a mortal be righteous before God?

contentJson: [{"text":"If one wished to contend with God,","poem":1},{"noteId":10},{"text":"he could not answer Him one time out of a thousand.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If one wished to contend with God, he could not answer Him one time out of a thousand.

contentJson: [{"text":"God is wise in heart and mighty in strength.","poem":1},{"text":"Who has resisted Him and prospered?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: God is wise in heart and mighty in strength. Who has resisted Him and prospered?

contentJson: [{"text":"He moves mountains without their knowledge","poem":1},{"text":"and overturns them in His anger.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He moves mountains without their knowledge and overturns them in His anger.

contentJson: [{"text":"He shakes the earth from its place,","poem":1},{"text":"so that its foundations tremble.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He shakes the earth from its place, so that its foundations tremble.

contentJson: [{"text":"He commands the sun not to shine;","poem":1},{"noteId":11},{"text":"He seals off the stars.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He commands the sun not to shine; He seals off the stars.

contentJson: [{"text":"He alone stretches out the heavens","poem":1},{"text":"and treads on the waves of the sea.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He alone stretches out the heavens and treads on the waves of the sea.

contentJson: [{"text":"He is the Maker of the Bear and Orion,","poem":1},{"text":"of the Pleiades and the constellations of the south.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He is the Maker of the Bear and Orion, of the Pleiades and the constellations of the south.

contentJson: [{"text":"He does great things beyond searching out,","poem":1},{"text":"and wonders without number.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He does great things beyond searching out, and wonders without number.

contentJson: [{"text":"Were He to pass by me, I would not see Him;","poem":1},{"text":"were He to move, I would not recognize Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Were He to pass by me, I would not see Him; were He to move, I would not recognize Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"If He takes away,","poem":1},{"noteId":12},{"text":"who can stop Him?","poem":1},{"text":"Who dares to ask Him, ‘What are You doing?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If He takes away, who can stop Him? Who dares to ask Him, ‘What are You doing?’

contentJson: [{"text":"God does not restrain His anger;","poem":1},{"text":"the helpers of Rahab cower beneath Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: God does not restrain His anger; the helpers of Rahab cower beneath Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"How then can I answer Him","poem":1},{"text":"or choose my arguments against Him?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How then can I answer Him or choose my arguments against Him?

contentJson: [{"text":"For even if I were right, I could not answer.","poem":1},{"text":"I could only beg my Judge for mercy.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For even if I were right, I could not answer. I could only beg my Judge for mercy.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I summoned Him and He answered me,","poem":1},{"text":"I do not believe He would listen to my voice.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I summoned Him and He answered me, I do not believe He would listen to my voice.

contentJson: [{"text":"For He would crush me with a tempest","poem":1},{"text":"and multiply my wounds without cause.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For He would crush me with a tempest and multiply my wounds without cause.

contentJson: [{"text":"He does not let me catch my breath,","poem":1},{"text":"but overwhelms me with bitterness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He does not let me catch my breath, but overwhelms me with bitterness.

contentJson: [{"text":"If it is a matter of strength,","poem":1},{"text":"He is indeed mighty!","poem":2},{"text":"If it is a matter of justice,","poem":1},{"text":"who can summon Him","poem":2},{"noteId":13},{"text":"?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If it is a matter of strength, He is indeed mighty! If it is a matter of justice, who can summon Him ?

contentJson: [{"text":"Even if I were righteous, my mouth would condemn me;","poem":1},{"text":"if I were blameless, it would declare me guilty.","poem":2},{"noteId":14}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even if I were righteous, my mouth would condemn me; if I were blameless, it would declare me guilty.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though I am blameless, I have no concern for myself;","poem":1},{"text":"I despise my own life.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though I am blameless, I have no concern for myself; I despise my own life.

contentJson: [{"text":"It is all the same, and so I say,","poem":1},{"text":"‘He destroys both the blameless and the wicked.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It is all the same, and so I say, ‘He destroys both the blameless and the wicked.’

contentJson: [{"text":"When the scourge brings sudden death,","poem":1},{"text":"He mocks the despair of the innocent.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When the scourge brings sudden death, He mocks the despair of the innocent.

contentJson: [{"text":"The earth is given into the hand of the wicked;","poem":1},{"text":"He blindfolds its judges.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"If it is not He, then who is it?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The earth is given into the hand of the wicked; He blindfolds its judges. 
If it is not He, then who is it?

contentJson: [{"text":"My days are swifter than a runner;","poem":1},{"text":"they flee without seeing good.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My days are swifter than a runner; they flee without seeing good.

contentJson: [{"text":"They sweep by like boats of papyrus,","poem":1},{"text":"like an eagle swooping down on its prey.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They sweep by like boats of papyrus, like an eagle swooping down on its prey.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I were to say, ‘I will forget my complaint","poem":1},{"text":"and change my expression and smile,’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I were to say, ‘I will forget my complaint and change my expression and smile,’

contentJson: [{"text":"I would still dread all my sufferings;","poem":1},{"text":"I know that You will not acquit me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I would still dread all my sufferings; I know that You will not acquit me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Since I am already found guilty,","poem":1},{"text":"why should I labor in vain?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Since I am already found guilty, why should I labor in vain?

contentJson: [{"text":"If I should wash myself with snow","poem":1},{"noteId":15},{"text":"and cleanse my hands with lye,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I should wash myself with snow and cleanse my hands with lye,

contentJson: [{"text":"then You would plunge me into the pit,","poem":1},{"text":"and even my own clothes would despise me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then You would plunge me into the pit, and even my own clothes would despise me.

contentJson: [{"text":"For He is not a man like me, that I can answer Him,","poem":1},{"text":"that we can take each other to court.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For He is not a man like me, that I can answer Him, that we can take each other to court.

contentJson: [{"text":"Nor is there a mediator between us,","poem":1},{"text":"to lay his hand upon us both.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Nor is there a mediator between us, to lay his hand upon us both.

contentJson: [{"text":"Let Him remove His rod from me,","poem":1},{"text":"so that His terror will no longer frighten me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Let Him remove His rod from me, so that His terror will no longer frighten me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then I would speak without fear of Him.","poem":1},{"text":"But as it is, I am on my own.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then I would speak without fear of Him. But as it is, I am on my own.

contentJson: [{"text":"“I loathe my own life;","poem":1},{"text":"I will express my complaint","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and speak in the bitterness of my soul.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
“I loathe my own life; I will express my complaint 
and speak in the bitterness of my soul.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will say to God:","poem":1},{"text":"Do not condemn me!","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Let me know why You prosecute me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will say to God: Do not condemn me! 
Let me know why You prosecute me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Does it please You to oppress me,","poem":1},{"text":"to reject the work of Your hands","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and favor the schemes of the wicked?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Does it please You to oppress me, to reject the work of Your hands 
and favor the schemes of the wicked?

contentJson: [{"text":"Do You have eyes of flesh?","poem":1},{"text":"Do You see as man sees?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do You have eyes of flesh? Do You see as man sees?

contentJson: [{"text":"Are Your days like those of a mortal,","poem":1},{"text":"or Your years like those of a man,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Are Your days like those of a mortal, or Your years like those of a man,

contentJson: [{"text":"that You should seek my iniquity","poem":1},{"text":"and search out my sin—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: that You should seek my iniquity and search out my sin—

contentJson: [{"text":"though You know that I am not guilty,","poem":1},{"text":"and there is no deliverance from Your hand?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: though You know that I am not guilty, and there is no deliverance from Your hand?

contentJson: [{"text":"Your hands shaped me and altogether formed me.","poem":1},{"text":"Would You now turn and destroy me?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your hands shaped me and altogether formed me. Would You now turn and destroy me?

contentJson: [{"text":"Please remember that You molded me like clay.","poem":1},{"text":"Would You now return me to dust?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Please remember that You molded me like clay. Would You now return me to dust?

contentJson: [{"text":"Did You not pour me out like milk,","poem":1},{"text":"and curdle me like cheese?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Did You not pour me out like milk, and curdle me like cheese?

contentJson: [{"text":"You clothed me with skin and flesh,","poem":1},{"text":"and knit me together with bones and sinews.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews.

contentJson: [{"text":"You have granted me life and loving devotion,","poem":1},{"noteId":16},{"text":"and Your care has preserved my spirit.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have granted me life and loving devotion, and Your care has preserved my spirit.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet You concealed these things in Your heart,","poem":1},{"text":"and I know that this was in Your mind:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet You concealed these things in Your heart, and I know that this was in Your mind:

contentJson: [{"text":"If I sinned, You would take note,","poem":1},{"text":"and would not acquit me of my iniquity.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I sinned, You would take note, and would not acquit me of my iniquity.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I am guilty, woe to me!","poem":1},{"text":"And even if I am righteous, I cannot lift my head.","poem":2},{"text":"I am full of shame","poem":1},{"text":"and aware of my affliction.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I am guilty, woe to me! And even if I am righteous, I cannot lift my head. I am full of shame and aware of my affliction.

contentJson: [{"text":"Should I hold my head high,","poem":1},{"text":"You would hunt me like a lion,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and again display Your power against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Should I hold my head high, You would hunt me like a lion, 
and again display Your power against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"You produce new witnesses against me","poem":1},{"text":"and multiply Your anger toward me.","poem":2},{"text":"Hardships assault me","poem":1},{"text":"in wave after wave.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You produce new witnesses against me and multiply Your anger toward me. Hardships assault me in wave after wave.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why then did You bring me from the womb?","poem":1},{"text":"Oh, that I had died, and no eye had seen me!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why then did You bring me from the womb? Oh, that I had died, and no eye had seen me!

contentJson: [{"text":"If only I had never come to be,","poem":1},{"text":"but had been carried from the womb to the grave.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If only I had never come to be, but had been carried from the womb to the grave.

contentJson: [{"text":"Are my days not few?","poem":1},{"text":"Withdraw from me, that I may have a little comfort,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Are my days not few? Withdraw from me, that I may have a little comfort,

contentJson: [{"text":"before I go—never to return—","poem":1},{"text":"to a land of darkness and gloom,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: before I go—never to return— to a land of darkness and gloom,

contentJson: [{"text":"to a land of utter darkness,","poem":1},{"text":"of deep shadow and disorder,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"where even the light is like darkness.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
to a land of utter darkness, of deep shadow and disorder, 
where even the light is like darkness.”

contentJson: ["Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Should this stream of words go unanswered","poem":1},{"text":"and such a speaker be vindicated?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Should this stream of words go unanswered and such a speaker be vindicated?

contentJson: [{"text":"Should your babbling put others to silence?","poem":1},{"text":"Will you scoff without rebuke?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Should your babbling put others to silence? Will you scoff without rebuke?

contentJson: [{"text":"You have said, ‘My doctrine is sound,","poem":1},{"text":"and I am pure in Your sight.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have said, ‘My doctrine is sound, and I am pure in Your sight.’

contentJson: [{"text":"But if only God would speak","poem":1},{"text":"and open His lips against you,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But if only God would speak and open His lips against you,

contentJson: [{"text":"and disclose to you the secrets of wisdom,","poem":1},{"text":"for true wisdom has two sides.","poem":2},{"text":"Know then that God exacts from you","poem":1},{"text":"less than your iniquity deserves.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: and disclose to you the secrets of wisdom, for true wisdom has two sides. Know then that God exacts from you less than your iniquity deserves.

contentJson: [{"text":"Can you fathom the deep things of God","poem":1},{"text":"or discover the limits of the Almighty?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Can you fathom the deep things of God or discover the limits of the Almighty?

contentJson: [{"text":"They are higher than the heavens—what can you do?","poem":1},{"text":"They are deeper than Sheol—what can you know?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They are higher than the heavens—what can you do? They are deeper than Sheol—what can you know?

contentJson: [{"text":"Their measure is longer than the earth","poem":1},{"text":"and wider than the sea.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Their measure is longer than the earth and wider than the sea.

contentJson: [{"text":"If He comes along to imprison you,","poem":1},{"text":"or convenes a court, who can stop Him?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If He comes along to imprison you, or convenes a court, who can stop Him?

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely He knows the deceit of men.","poem":1},{"text":"If He sees iniquity, does He not take note?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely He knows the deceit of men. If He sees iniquity, does He not take note?

contentJson: [{"text":"But a witless man can no more become wise","poem":1},{"text":"than the colt of a wild donkey can be born a man!","poem":2},{"noteId":17}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But a witless man can no more become wise than the colt of a wild donkey can be born a man!

contentJson: [{"text":"As for you, if you direct your heart","poem":1},{"text":"and lift up your hands to Him,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As for you, if you direct your heart and lift up your hands to Him,

contentJson: [{"text":"if you put away the iniquity in your hand,","poem":1},{"text":"and allow no injustice to dwell in your tents,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if you put away the iniquity in your hand, and allow no injustice to dwell in your tents,

contentJson: [{"text":"then indeed you will lift up your face without shame;","poem":1},{"text":"you will stand firm and unafraid.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then indeed you will lift up your face without shame; you will stand firm and unafraid.

contentJson: [{"text":"For you will forget your misery,","poem":1},{"text":"recalling it only as waters gone by.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For you will forget your misery, recalling it only as waters gone by.

contentJson: [{"text":"Your life will be brighter than noonday;","poem":1},{"text":"its darkness will be like the morning.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your life will be brighter than noonday; its darkness will be like the morning.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will be secure, because there is hope,","poem":1},{"text":"and you will look around and lie down in safety.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will be secure, because there is hope, and you will look around and lie down in safety.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will lie down without fear,","poem":1},{"text":"and many will court your favor.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will lie down without fear, and many will court your favor.

contentJson: [{"text":"But the eyes of the wicked will fail,","poem":1},{"text":"and escape will elude them;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"they will hope for their last breath.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
But the eyes of the wicked will fail, and escape will elude them; 
they will hope for their last breath.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Truly then you are the people","poem":1},{"text":"with whom wisdom itself will die!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Truly then you are the people with whom wisdom itself will die!

contentJson: [{"text":"But I also have a mind;","poem":1},{"text":"I am not inferior to you.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Who does not know such things as these?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
But I also have a mind; I am not inferior to you. 
Who does not know such things as these?

contentJson: [{"text":"I am a laughingstock to my friends,","poem":1},{"text":"though I called on God, and He answered.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"The righteous and upright man is a laughingstock.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I am a laughingstock to my friends, though I called on God, and He answered. 
The righteous and upright man is a laughingstock.

contentJson: [{"text":"The one at ease scorns misfortune","poem":1},{"text":"as the fate of those whose feet are slipping.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The one at ease scorns misfortune as the fate of those whose feet are slipping.

contentJson: [{"text":"The tents of robbers are safe,","poem":1},{"text":"and those who provoke God are secure—","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"those who carry their god in their hands.","poem":2},{"noteId":18}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The tents of robbers are safe, and those who provoke God are secure— 
those who carry their god in their hands.

contentJson: [{"text":"But ask the animals, and they will instruct you;","poem":1},{"text":"ask the birds of the air, and they will tell you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But ask the animals, and they will instruct you; ask the birds of the air, and they will tell you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you;","poem":1},{"text":"let the fish of the sea inform you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Or speak to the earth, and it will teach you; let the fish of the sea inform you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Which of all these does not know","poem":1},{"text":"that the hand of the LORD has done this?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Which of all these does not know that the hand of the LORD has done this?

contentJson: [{"text":"The life of every living thing is in His hand,","poem":1},{"text":"as well as the breath of all mankind.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The life of every living thing is in His hand, as well as the breath of all mankind.

contentJson: [{"text":"Does not the ear test words","poem":1},{"text":"as the tongue tastes its food?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does not the ear test words as the tongue tastes its food?

contentJson: [{"text":"Wisdom is found with the elderly,","poem":1},{"text":"and understanding comes with long life.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Wisdom is found with the elderly, and understanding comes with long life.

contentJson: [{"text":"Wisdom and strength belong to God;","poem":1},{"text":"counsel and understanding are His.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Wisdom and strength belong to God; counsel and understanding are His.

contentJson: [{"text":"What He tears down cannot be rebuilt;","poem":1},{"text":"the man He imprisons cannot be released.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What He tears down cannot be rebuilt; the man He imprisons cannot be released.

contentJson: [{"text":"If He holds back the waters, they dry up,","poem":1},{"text":"and if He releases them, they overwhelm the land.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If He holds back the waters, they dry up, and if He releases them, they overwhelm the land.

contentJson: [{"text":"True wisdom and power belong to Him.","poem":1},{"text":"The deceived and the deceiver are His.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: True wisdom and power belong to Him. The deceived and the deceiver are His.

contentJson: [{"text":"He leads counselors away barefoot","poem":1},{"text":"and makes fools of judges.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He leads counselors away barefoot and makes fools of judges.

contentJson: [{"text":"He loosens the bonds placed by kings","poem":1},{"text":"and fastens a belt around their waists.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He loosens the bonds placed by kings and fastens a belt around their waists.

contentJson: [{"text":"He leads priests away barefoot","poem":1},{"text":"and overthrows the established.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He leads priests away barefoot and overthrows the established.

contentJson: [{"text":"He deprives the trusted of speech","poem":1},{"text":"and takes away the discernment of elders.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He deprives the trusted of speech and takes away the discernment of elders.

contentJson: [{"text":"He pours out contempt on nobles","poem":1},{"text":"and disarms the mighty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He pours out contempt on nobles and disarms the mighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"He reveals the deep things of darkness","poem":1},{"text":"and brings deep shadows into light.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He reveals the deep things of darkness and brings deep shadows into light.

contentJson: [{"text":"He makes nations great and destroys them;","poem":1},{"text":"He enlarges nations, then disperses them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He makes nations great and destroys them; He enlarges nations, then disperses them.

contentJson: [{"text":"He deprives the earth’s leaders of reason","poem":1},{"text":"and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He deprives the earth’s leaders of reason and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.

contentJson: [{"text":"They grope in the darkness without light;","poem":1},{"text":"He makes them stagger like drunkards.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They grope in the darkness without light; He makes them stagger like drunkards.

contentJson: [{"text":"“Indeed, my eyes have seen all this;","poem":1},{"text":"my ears have heard and understood.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Indeed, my eyes have seen all this; my ears have heard and understood.

contentJson: [{"text":"What you know, I also know;","poem":1},{"text":"I am not inferior to you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What you know, I also know; I am not inferior to you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet I desire to speak to the Almighty","poem":1},{"text":"and argue my case before God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet I desire to speak to the Almighty and argue my case before God.

contentJson: [{"text":"You, however, smear with lies;","poem":1},{"text":"you are all worthless physicians.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You, however, smear with lies; you are all worthless physicians.

contentJson: [{"text":"If only you would remain silent;","poem":1},{"text":"for that would be your wisdom!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If only you would remain silent; for that would be your wisdom!

contentJson: [{"text":"Hear now my argument,","poem":1},{"text":"and listen to the plea of my lips.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Hear now my argument, and listen to the plea of my lips.

contentJson: [{"text":"Will you speak wickedly on God’s behalf","poem":1},{"text":"or speak deceitfully for Him?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will you speak wickedly on God’s behalf or speak deceitfully for Him?

contentJson: [{"text":"Would you show Him partiality","poem":1},{"text":"or argue in His defense?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Would you show Him partiality or argue in His defense?

contentJson: [{"text":"Would it be well when He examined you?","poem":1},{"text":"Could you deceive Him like a man?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Would it be well when He examined you? Could you deceive Him like a man?

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely He would rebuke you","poem":1},{"text":"if you secretly showed partiality.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely He would rebuke you if you secretly showed partiality.

contentJson: [{"text":"Would His majesty not terrify you?","poem":1},{"text":"Would the dread of Him not fall upon you?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Would His majesty not terrify you? Would the dread of Him not fall upon you?

contentJson: [{"text":"Your maxims are proverbs of ashes;","poem":1},{"text":"your defenses are defenses of clay.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your maxims are proverbs of ashes; your defenses are defenses of clay.

contentJson: [{"text":"Be silent, and I will speak.","poem":1},{"text":"Then let come to me what may.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Be silent, and I will speak. Then let come to me what may.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why do I put myself at risk","poem":1},{"noteId":19},{"text":"and take my life in my own hands?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do I put myself at risk and take my life in my own hands?

contentJson: [{"text":"Though He slay me, I will hope in Him.","poem":1},{"noteId":20},{"text":"I will still defend my ways to His face.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though He slay me, I will hope in Him. I will still defend my ways to His face.

contentJson: [{"text":"Moreover, this will be my salvation,","poem":1},{"text":"for no godless man can appear before Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Moreover, this will be my salvation, for no godless man can appear before Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"Listen carefully to my words;","poem":1},{"text":"let my declaration ring in your ears.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Listen carefully to my words; let my declaration ring in your ears.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, now that I have prepared my case,","poem":1},{"text":"I know that I will be vindicated.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, now that I have prepared my case, I know that I will be vindicated.

contentJson: [{"text":"Can anyone indict me?","poem":1},{"text":"If so, I will be silent and die.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Can anyone indict me? If so, I will be silent and die.

contentJson: [{"text":"Only grant these two things to me,","poem":1},{"text":"so that I need not hide from You:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Only grant these two things to me, so that I need not hide from You:

contentJson: [{"text":"Withdraw Your hand from me,","poem":1},{"text":"and do not let Your terror frighten me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Withdraw Your hand from me, and do not let Your terror frighten me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then call me, and I will answer,","poem":1},{"text":"or let me speak, and You can reply.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then call me, and I will answer, or let me speak, and You can reply.

contentJson: [{"text":"How many are my iniquities and sins?","poem":1},{"text":"Reveal to me my transgression and sin.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How many are my iniquities and sins? Reveal to me my transgression and sin.
