contentJson: [{"text":"Why do You hide Your face","poem":1},{"text":"and consider me as Your enemy?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do You hide Your face and consider me as Your enemy?

contentJson: [{"text":"Would You frighten a windblown leaf?","poem":1},{"text":"Would You chase after dry chaff?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Would You frighten a windblown leaf? Would You chase after dry chaff?

contentJson: [{"text":"For You record bitter accusations against me","poem":1},{"text":"and bequeath to me the iniquities of my youth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For You record bitter accusations against me and bequeath to me the iniquities of my youth.

contentJson: [{"text":"You put my feet in the stocks","poem":1},{"text":"and stand watch over all my paths;","poem":2},{"text":"You set a limit","poem":1},{"text":"for the soles of my feet.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You put my feet in the stocks and stand watch over all my paths; You set a limit for the soles of my feet.

contentJson: [{"text":"So man wastes away like something rotten,","poem":1},{"text":"like a moth-eaten garment.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So man wastes away like something rotten, like a moth-eaten garment.

contentJson: [{"text":"“Man, who is born of woman,","poem":1},{"text":"is short of days and full of trouble.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Man, who is born of woman, is short of days and full of trouble.

contentJson: [{"text":"Like a flower, he comes forth, then withers away;","poem":1},{"text":"like a fleeting shadow, he does not endure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Like a flower, he comes forth, then withers away; like a fleeting shadow, he does not endure.

contentJson: [{"text":"Do You open Your eyes to one like this?","poem":1},{"text":"Will You bring him into judgment before You?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do You open Your eyes to one like this? Will You bring him into judgment before You?

contentJson: [{"text":"Who can bring out clean from unclean?","poem":1},{"text":"No one!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Who can bring out clean from unclean? No one!

contentJson: [{"text":"Since his days are determined","poem":1},{"text":"and the number of his months is with You,","poem":2},{"text":"and since You have set limits","poem":1},{"text":"that he cannot exceed,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Since his days are determined and the number of his months is with You, and since You have set limits that he cannot exceed,

contentJson: [{"text":"look away from him and let him rest,","poem":1},{"text":"so he can enjoy his day as a hired hand.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: look away from him and let him rest, so he can enjoy his day as a hired hand.

contentJson: [{"text":"For there is hope for a tree:","poem":1},{"text":"If it is cut down, it will sprout again,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and its tender shoots will not fail.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
For there is hope for a tree: If it is cut down, it will sprout again, 
and its tender shoots will not fail.

contentJson: [{"text":"If its roots grow old in the ground","poem":1},{"text":"and its stump dies in the soil,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If its roots grow old in the ground and its stump dies in the soil,

contentJson: [{"text":"at the scent of water it will bud","poem":1},{"text":"and put forth twigs like a sapling.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: at the scent of water it will bud and put forth twigs like a sapling.

contentJson: [{"text":"But a man dies and is laid low;","poem":1},{"text":"he breathes his last, and where is he?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But a man dies and is laid low; he breathes his last, and where is he?

contentJson: [{"text":"As water disappears from the sea","poem":1},{"text":"and a river becomes parched and dry,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As water disappears from the sea and a river becomes parched and dry,

contentJson: [{"text":"so a man lies down","poem":1},{"text":"and does not rise.","poem":2},{"text":"Until the heavens are no more,","poem":1},{"text":"he will not be awakened or roused from sleep.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: so a man lies down and does not rise. Until the heavens are no more, he will not be awakened or roused from sleep.

contentJson: [{"text":"If only You would hide me in Sheol","poem":1},{"text":"and conceal me until Your anger has passed!","poem":2},{"text":"If only You would appoint a time for me","poem":1},{"text":"and then remember me!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If only You would hide me in Sheol and conceal me until Your anger has passed! If only You would appoint a time for me and then remember me!

contentJson: [{"text":"When a man dies, will he live again?","poem":1},{"text":"All the days of my hard service I will wait,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"until my renewal","poem":2},{"noteId":21},{"text":"comes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
When a man dies, will he live again? All the days of my hard service I will wait, 
until my renewal comes.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will call, and I will answer;","poem":1},{"text":"You will desire the work of Your hands.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will call, and I will answer; You will desire the work of Your hands.

contentJson: [{"text":"For then You would count my steps,","poem":1},{"text":"but would not keep track of my sin.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For then You would count my steps, but would not keep track of my sin.

contentJson: [{"text":"My transgression would be sealed in a bag,","poem":1},{"text":"and You would cover over my iniquity.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My transgression would be sealed in a bag, and You would cover over my iniquity.

contentJson: [{"text":"But as a mountain erodes and crumbles","poem":1},{"text":"and a rock is dislodged from its place,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But as a mountain erodes and crumbles and a rock is dislodged from its place,

contentJson: [{"text":"as water wears away the stones","poem":1},{"text":"and torrents wash away the soil,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"so You destroy a man’s hope.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
as water wears away the stones and torrents wash away the soil, 
so You destroy a man’s hope.

contentJson: [{"text":"You forever overpower him, and he passes on;","poem":1},{"text":"You change his countenance and send him away.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You forever overpower him, and he passes on; You change his countenance and send him away.

contentJson: [{"text":"If his sons receive honor, he does not know it;","poem":1},{"text":"if they are brought low, he is unaware.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If his sons receive honor, he does not know it; if they are brought low, he is unaware.

contentJson: [{"text":"He feels only the pain of his own body","poem":1},{"text":"and mourns only for himself.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He feels only the pain of his own body and mourns only for himself.”

contentJson: ["Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Does a wise man answer with empty counsel","poem":1},{"text":"or fill his belly with the hot east wind?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Does a wise man answer with empty counsel or fill his belly with the hot east wind?

contentJson: [{"text":"Should he argue with useless words","poem":1},{"text":"or speeches that serve no purpose?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Should he argue with useless words or speeches that serve no purpose?

contentJson: [{"text":"But you even undermine the fear of God","poem":1},{"text":"and hinder meditation before Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But you even undermine the fear of God and hinder meditation before Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"For your iniquity instructs your mouth,","poem":1},{"text":"and you choose the language of the crafty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For your iniquity instructs your mouth, and you choose the language of the crafty.

contentJson: [{"text":"Your own mouth, not mine, condemns you;","poem":1},{"text":"your own lips testify against you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your own mouth, not mine, condemns you; your own lips testify against you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Were you the first man ever born?","poem":1},{"text":"Were you brought forth before the hills?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Were you the first man ever born? Were you brought forth before the hills?

contentJson: [{"text":"Do you listen in on the council of God","poem":1},{"text":"or limit wisdom to yourself?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do you listen in on the council of God or limit wisdom to yourself?

contentJson: [{"text":"What do you know that we do not?","poem":1},{"text":"What do you understand that is not clear to us?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What do you know that we do not? What do you understand that is not clear to us?

contentJson: [{"text":"Both the gray-haired and the aged are on our side—","poem":1},{"text":"men much older than your father.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Both the gray-haired and the aged are on our side— men much older than your father.

contentJson: [{"text":"Are the consolations of God not enough for you,","poem":1},{"text":"even words spoken gently to you?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Are the consolations of God not enough for you, even words spoken gently to you?

contentJson: [{"text":"Why has your heart carried you away,","poem":1},{"text":"and why do your eyes flash,","poem":2},{"noteId":22}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why has your heart carried you away, and why do your eyes flash,

contentJson: [{"text":"as you turn your spirit against God","poem":1},{"text":"and pour such words from your mouth?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: as you turn your spirit against God and pour such words from your mouth?

contentJson: [{"text":"What is man, that he should be pure,","poem":1},{"text":"or one born of woman, that he should be righteous?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What is man, that he should be pure, or one born of woman, that he should be righteous?

contentJson: [{"text":"If God puts no trust in His holy ones,","poem":1},{"text":"if even the heavens are not pure in His eyes,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If God puts no trust in His holy ones, if even the heavens are not pure in His eyes,

contentJson: [{"text":"how much less man, who is vile and corrupt,","poem":1},{"text":"who drinks injustice like water?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: how much less man, who is vile and corrupt, who drinks injustice like water?

contentJson: [{"text":"Listen to me and I will inform you.","poem":1},{"text":"I will describe what I have seen,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Listen to me and I will inform you. I will describe what I have seen,

contentJson: [{"text":"what was declared by wise men","poem":1},{"text":"and was not concealed from their fathers,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: what was declared by wise men and was not concealed from their fathers,

contentJson: [{"text":"to whom alone the land was given","poem":1},{"text":"when no foreigner passed among them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: to whom alone the land was given when no foreigner passed among them.

contentJson: [{"text":"A wicked man writhes in pain all his days;","poem":1},{"text":"only a few years are reserved for the ruthless.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A wicked man writhes in pain all his days; only a few years are reserved for the ruthless.

contentJson: [{"text":"Sounds of terror fill his ears;","poem":1},{"text":"in his prosperity the destroyer attacks him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Sounds of terror fill his ears; in his prosperity the destroyer attacks him.

contentJson: [{"text":"He despairs of his return from darkness;","poem":1},{"text":"he is marked for the sword.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He despairs of his return from darkness; he is marked for the sword.

contentJson: [{"text":"He wanders about as food for vultures;","poem":1},{"text":"he knows the day of darkness is at hand.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He wanders about as food for vultures; he knows the day of darkness is at hand.

contentJson: [{"text":"Distress and anguish terrify him,","poem":1},{"text":"overwhelming him like a king poised to attack.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Distress and anguish terrify him, overwhelming him like a king poised to attack.

contentJson: [{"text":"For he has stretched out his hand against God","poem":1},{"text":"and has vaunted himself against the Almighty,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For he has stretched out his hand against God and has vaunted himself against the Almighty,

contentJson: [{"text":"rushing headlong at Him","poem":1},{"text":"with a thick, studded shield.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: rushing headlong at Him with a thick, studded shield.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though his face is covered with fat","poem":1},{"text":"and his waistline bulges with flesh,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though his face is covered with fat and his waistline bulges with flesh,

contentJson: [{"text":"he will dwell in ruined cities,","poem":1},{"text":"in abandoned houses destined to become rubble.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: he will dwell in ruined cities, in abandoned houses destined to become rubble.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will no longer be rich; his wealth will not endure.","poem":1},{"text":"His possessions will not overspread the land.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will no longer be rich; his wealth will not endure. His possessions will not overspread the land.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will not escape from the darkness;","poem":1},{"text":"the flame will wither his shoots,","poem":2},{"text":"and the breath of God’s mouth","poem":1},{"text":"will carry him away.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will not escape from the darkness; the flame will wither his shoots, and the breath of God’s mouth will carry him away.

contentJson: [{"text":"Let him not deceive himself with trust in emptiness,","poem":1},{"text":"for emptiness will be his reward.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Let him not deceive himself with trust in emptiness, for emptiness will be his reward.

contentJson: [{"text":"It will be paid in full before his time,","poem":1},{"text":"and his branch will not flourish.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It will be paid in full before his time, and his branch will not flourish.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will be like a vine stripped of its unripe grapes,","poem":1},{"text":"like an olive tree that sheds its blossoms.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will be like a vine stripped of its unripe grapes, like an olive tree that sheds its blossoms.

contentJson: [{"text":"For the company of the godless will be barren,","poem":1},{"text":"and fire will consume the tents of bribery.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For the company of the godless will be barren, and fire will consume the tents of bribery.

contentJson: [{"text":"They conceive trouble and give birth to evil;","poem":1},{"text":"their womb is pregnant with deceit.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They conceive trouble and give birth to evil; their womb is pregnant with deceit.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“I have heard many things like these;","poem":1},{"text":"miserable comforters are you all.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “I have heard many things like these; miserable comforters are you all.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is there no end to your long-winded speeches?","poem":1},{"text":"What provokes you to continue testifying?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is there no end to your long-winded speeches? What provokes you to continue testifying?

contentJson: [{"text":"I could also speak like you","poem":1},{"text":"if you were in my place;","poem":2},{"text":"I could heap up words against you","poem":1},{"text":"and shake my head at you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I could also speak like you if you were in my place; I could heap up words against you and shake my head at you.

contentJson: [{"text":"But I would encourage you with my mouth,","poem":1},{"text":"and the consolation of my lips would bring relief.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But I would encourage you with my mouth, and the consolation of my lips would bring relief.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even if I speak, my pain is not relieved,","poem":1},{"text":"and if I hold back, how will it go away?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even if I speak, my pain is not relieved, and if I hold back, how will it go away?

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely He has now exhausted me;","poem":1},{"text":"You have devastated all my family.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely He has now exhausted me; You have devastated all my family.

contentJson: [{"text":"You have bound me, and it has become a witness;","poem":1},{"text":"my frailty rises up and testifies against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have bound me, and it has become a witness; my frailty rises up and testifies against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"His anger has torn me and opposed me;","poem":1},{"text":"He gnashes His teeth at me.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"My adversary pierces me with His eyes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
His anger has torn me and opposed me; He gnashes His teeth at me. 
My adversary pierces me with His eyes.

contentJson: [{"text":"They open their mouths against me","poem":1},{"text":"and strike my cheeks with contempt;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"they join together against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
They open their mouths against me and strike my cheeks with contempt; 
they join together against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"God has delivered me to unjust men;","poem":1},{"text":"He has thrown me to the clutches of the wicked.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: God has delivered me to unjust men; He has thrown me to the clutches of the wicked.

contentJson: [{"text":"I was at ease, but He shattered me;","poem":1},{"text":"He seized me by the neck and crushed me.","poem":2},{"text":"He has set me up as His target;","poem":1}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I was at ease, but He shattered me; He seized me by the neck and crushed me. He has set me up as His target;

contentJson: [{"text":"His archers surround me.","poem":2},{"text":"He pierces my kidneys without mercy","poem":1},{"text":"and spills my gall on the ground.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His archers surround me. He pierces my kidneys without mercy and spills my gall on the ground.

contentJson: [{"text":"He breaks me with wound upon wound;","poem":1},{"text":"He rushes me like a mighty warrior.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He breaks me with wound upon wound; He rushes me like a mighty warrior.

contentJson: [{"text":"I have sewn sackcloth over my skin;","poem":1},{"text":"I have buried my horn in the dust.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have sewn sackcloth over my skin; I have buried my horn in the dust.

contentJson: [{"text":"My face is red with weeping,","poem":1},{"text":"and deep shadows ring my eyes;","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My face is red with weeping, and deep shadows ring my eyes;

contentJson: [{"text":"yet my hands are free of violence","poem":1},{"text":"and my prayer is pure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: yet my hands are free of violence and my prayer is pure.

contentJson: [{"text":"O earth, do not cover my blood;","poem":1},{"text":"may my cry for help never be laid to rest.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: O earth, do not cover my blood; may my cry for help never be laid to rest.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even now my witness is in heaven,","poem":1},{"text":"and my advocate is on high.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even now my witness is in heaven, and my advocate is on high.

contentJson: [{"text":"My friends are my scoffers","poem":1},{"text":"as my eyes pour out tears to God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My friends are my scoffers as my eyes pour out tears to God.

contentJson: [{"text":"Oh, that a man might plead with God","poem":1},{"text":"as he pleads with his neighbor!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Oh, that a man might plead with God as he pleads with his neighbor!

contentJson: [{"text":"For when only a few years are past","poem":1},{"text":"I will go the way of no return.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For when only a few years are past I will go the way of no return.

contentJson: [{"text":"“My spirit is broken; my days are extinguished;","poem":1},{"text":"the grave awaits me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “My spirit is broken; my days are extinguished; the grave awaits me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely mockers surround me,","poem":1},{"text":"and my eyes must gaze at their rebellion.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely mockers surround me, and my eyes must gaze at their rebellion.

contentJson: [{"text":"Give me, I pray, the pledge You demand.","poem":1},{"text":"Who else will be my guarantor?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Give me, I pray, the pledge You demand. Who else will be my guarantor?

contentJson: [{"text":"You have closed their minds to understanding;","poem":1},{"text":"therefore You will not exalt them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have closed their minds to understanding; therefore You will not exalt them.

contentJson: [{"text":"If a man denounces his friends for a price,","poem":1},{"text":"the eyes of his children will fail.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If a man denounces his friends for a price, the eyes of his children will fail.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has made me a byword among the people,","poem":1},{"text":"a man in whose face they spit.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has made me a byword among the people, a man in whose face they spit.

contentJson: [{"text":"My eyes have grown dim with grief,","poem":1},{"text":"and my whole body is but a shadow.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My eyes have grown dim with grief, and my whole body is but a shadow.

contentJson: [{"text":"The upright are appalled at this,","poem":1},{"text":"and the innocent are stirred against the godless.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The upright are appalled at this, and the innocent are stirred against the godless.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet a righteous one holds to his way,","poem":1},{"text":"and the one with clean hands grows stronger.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet a righteous one holds to his way, and the one with clean hands grows stronger.

contentJson: [{"text":"But come back and try again, all of you.","poem":1},{"text":"For I will not find a wise man among you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But come back and try again, all of you. For I will not find a wise man among you.

contentJson: [{"text":"My days have passed; my plans are broken off—","poem":1},{"text":"even the desires of my heart.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My days have passed; my plans are broken off— even the desires of my heart.

contentJson: [{"text":"They have turned night into day,","poem":1},{"text":"making light seem near in the face of darkness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They have turned night into day, making light seem near in the face of darkness.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I look for Sheol as my home,","poem":1},{"text":"if I spread out my bed in darkness,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I look for Sheol as my home, if I spread out my bed in darkness,

contentJson: [{"text":"and say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’","poem":1},{"text":"and to the worm, ‘My mother,’ or ‘My sister,’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: and say to corruption, ‘You are my father,’ and to the worm, ‘My mother,’ or ‘My sister,’

contentJson: [{"text":"where then is my hope?","poem":1},{"text":"Who can see any hope for me?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: where then is my hope? Who can see any hope for me?

contentJson: [{"text":"Will it go down to the gates of Sheol?","poem":1},{"text":"Will we go down together into the dust?”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will it go down to the gates of Sheol? Will we go down together into the dust?”

contentJson: ["Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“How long until you end these speeches?","poem":1},{"text":"Show some sense, and then we can talk.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “How long until you end these speeches? Show some sense, and then we can talk.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why are we regarded as cattle,","poem":1},{"text":"as stupid in your sight?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why are we regarded as cattle, as stupid in your sight?

contentJson: [{"text":"You who tear yourself in anger—","poem":1},{"text":"should the earth be forsaken on your account,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"or the rocks be moved from their place?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
You who tear yourself in anger— should the earth be forsaken on your account, 
or the rocks be moved from their place?

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, the lamp of the wicked is extinguished;","poem":1},{"text":"the flame of his fire does not glow.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Indeed, the lamp of the wicked is extinguished; the flame of his fire does not glow.

contentJson: [{"text":"The light in his tent grows dark,","poem":1},{"text":"and the lamp beside him goes out.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The light in his tent grows dark, and the lamp beside him goes out.

contentJson: [{"text":"His vigorous stride is shortened,","poem":1},{"text":"and his own schemes trip him up.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His vigorous stride is shortened, and his own schemes trip him up.

contentJson: [{"text":"For his own feet lead him into a net,","poem":1},{"text":"and he wanders into its mesh.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For his own feet lead him into a net, and he wanders into its mesh.

contentJson: [{"text":"A trap seizes his heel;","poem":1},{"text":"a snare grips him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A trap seizes his heel; a snare grips him.

contentJson: [{"text":"A noose is hidden in the ground,","poem":1},{"text":"and a trap lies in his path.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A noose is hidden in the ground, and a trap lies in his path.

contentJson: [{"text":"Terrors frighten him on every side","poem":1},{"text":"and harass his every step.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Terrors frighten him on every side and harass his every step.

contentJson: [{"text":"His strength is depleted,","poem":1},{"text":"and calamity is ready at his side.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His strength is depleted, and calamity is ready at his side.

contentJson: [{"text":"It devours patches of his skin;","poem":1},{"text":"the firstborn of death devours his limbs.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It devours patches of his skin; the firstborn of death devours his limbs.

contentJson: [{"text":"He is torn from the shelter of his tent","poem":1},{"text":"and is marched off to the king of terrors.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He is torn from the shelter of his tent and is marched off to the king of terrors.

contentJson: [{"text":"Fire resides in his tent;","poem":1},{"text":"burning sulfur rains down on his dwelling.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Fire resides in his tent; burning sulfur rains down on his dwelling.

contentJson: [{"text":"The roots beneath him dry up,","poem":1},{"text":"and the branches above him wither away.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The roots beneath him dry up, and the branches above him wither away.

contentJson: [{"text":"The memory of him perishes from the earth,","poem":1},{"text":"and he has no name in the land.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The memory of him perishes from the earth, and he has no name in the land.

contentJson: [{"text":"He is driven from light into darkness","poem":1},{"text":"and is chased from the inhabited world.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He is driven from light into darkness and is chased from the inhabited world.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has no offspring or posterity among his people,","poem":1},{"text":"no survivor where he once lived.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has no offspring or posterity among his people, no survivor where he once lived.

contentJson: [{"text":"Those in the west are appalled at his fate,","poem":1},{"text":"while those in the east tremble in horror.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Those in the west are appalled at his fate, while those in the east tremble in horror.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely such is the dwelling of the wicked","poem":1},{"text":"and the place of one who does not know God.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely such is the dwelling of the wicked and the place of one who does not know God.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“How long will you torment me","poem":1},{"text":"and crush me with your words?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “How long will you torment me and crush me with your words?

contentJson: [{"text":"Ten times now you have reproached me;","poem":1},{"text":"you shamelessly mistreat me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Ten times now you have reproached me; you shamelessly mistreat me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even if I have truly gone astray,","poem":1},{"text":"my error concerns me alone.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even if I have truly gone astray, my error concerns me alone.

contentJson: [{"text":"If indeed you would exalt yourselves above me","poem":1},{"text":"and use my disgrace against me,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If indeed you would exalt yourselves above me and use my disgrace against me,

contentJson: [{"text":"then understand that it is God who has wronged me","poem":1},{"text":"and drawn His net around me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then understand that it is God who has wronged me and drawn His net around me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though I cry out, ‘Violence!’ I get no response;","poem":1},{"text":"though I call for help, there is no justice.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though I cry out, ‘Violence!’ I get no response; though I call for help, there is no justice.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has blocked my way so I cannot pass;","poem":1},{"text":"He has veiled my paths with darkness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has blocked my way so I cannot pass; He has veiled my paths with darkness.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has stripped me of my honor","poem":1},{"text":"and removed the crown from my head.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has stripped me of my honor and removed the crown from my head.

contentJson: [{"text":"He tears me down on every side until I am gone;","poem":1},{"text":"He uproots my hope like a tree.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He tears me down on every side until I am gone; He uproots my hope like a tree.

contentJson: [{"text":"His anger burns against me,","poem":1},{"text":"and He counts me among His enemies.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His anger burns against me, and He counts me among His enemies.

contentJson: [{"text":"His troops advance together;","poem":1},{"text":"they construct a ramp against me","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and encamp around my tent.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
His troops advance together; they construct a ramp against me 
and encamp around my tent.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has removed my brothers from me;","poem":1},{"text":"my acquaintances have abandoned me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has removed my brothers from me; my acquaintances have abandoned me.

contentJson: [{"text":"My kinsmen have failed me,","poem":1},{"text":"and my friends have forgotten me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My kinsmen have failed me, and my friends have forgotten me.

contentJson: [{"text":"My guests and maidservants count me as a stranger;","poem":1},{"text":"I am a foreigner in their sight.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My guests and maidservants count me as a stranger; I am a foreigner in their sight.

contentJson: [{"text":"I call for my servant, but he does not answer,","poem":1},{"text":"though I implore him with my own mouth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I call for my servant, but he does not answer, though I implore him with my own mouth.

contentJson: [{"text":"My breath is repulsive to my wife,","poem":1},{"text":"and I am loathsome to my own family.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My breath is repulsive to my wife, and I am loathsome to my own family.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even little boys scorn me;","poem":1},{"text":"when I appear, they deride me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even little boys scorn me; when I appear, they deride me.

contentJson: [{"text":"All my best friends despise me,","poem":1},{"text":"and those I love have turned against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: All my best friends despise me, and those I love have turned against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"My skin and flesh cling to my bones;","poem":1},{"text":"I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My skin and flesh cling to my bones; I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.

contentJson: [{"text":"Have pity on me, my friends, have pity,","poem":1},{"text":"for the hand of God has struck me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Have pity on me, my friends, have pity, for the hand of God has struck me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why do you persecute me as God does?","poem":1},{"text":"Will you never get enough of my flesh?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do you persecute me as God does? Will you never get enough of my flesh?

contentJson: [{"text":"I wish that my words were recorded","poem":1},{"text":"and inscribed in a book,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I wish that my words were recorded and inscribed in a book,

contentJson: [{"text":"by an iron stylus on lead,","poem":1},{"text":"or chiseled in stone forever.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: by an iron stylus on lead, or chiseled in stone forever.

contentJson: [{"text":"But I know that my Redeemer","poem":1},{"noteId":23},{"text":"lives,","poem":1},{"text":"and in the end He will stand upon the earth.","poem":2},{"noteId":24}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But I know that my Redeemer lives, and in the end He will stand upon the earth.

contentJson: [{"text":"Even after my skin has been destroyed,","poem":1},{"text":"yet in my flesh","poem":2},{"noteId":25},{"text":"I will see God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Even after my skin has been destroyed, yet in my flesh I will see God.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will see Him for myself;","poem":1},{"text":"my eyes will behold Him, and not as a stranger.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"How my heart yearns","poem":2},{"noteId":26},{"text":"within me!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I will see Him for myself; my eyes will behold Him, and not as a stranger. 
How my heart yearns within me!

contentJson: [{"text":"If you say, ‘Let us persecute him,","poem":1},{"text":"since the root of the matter lies with him,","poem":2},{"noteId":27},{"text":"’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If you say, ‘Let us persecute him, since the root of the matter lies with him, ’

contentJson: [{"text":"then you should fear the sword yourselves,","poem":1},{"text":"because wrath brings punishment by the sword,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"so that you may know there is a judgment.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
then you should fear the sword yourselves, because wrath brings punishment by the sword, 
so that you may know there is a judgment.”

contentJson: ["Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Zophar the Naamathite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“So my anxious thoughts compel me to answer,","poem":1},{"text":"because of the turmoil within me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “So my anxious thoughts compel me to answer, because of the turmoil within me.

contentJson: [{"text":"I have heard a rebuke that insults me,","poem":1},{"text":"and my understanding prompts a reply.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have heard a rebuke that insults me, and my understanding prompts a reply.

contentJson: [{"text":"Do you not know that from antiquity,","poem":1},{"text":"since man was placed on the earth,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Do you not know that from antiquity, since man was placed on the earth,

contentJson: [{"text":"the triumph of the wicked has been brief","poem":1},{"text":"and the joy of the godless momentary?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the triumph of the wicked has been brief and the joy of the godless momentary?

contentJson: [{"text":"Though his arrogance reaches the heavens,","poem":1},{"text":"and his head touches the clouds,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though his arrogance reaches the heavens, and his head touches the clouds,

contentJson: [{"text":"he will perish forever, like his own dung;","poem":1},{"text":"those who had seen him will ask, ‘Where is he?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: he will perish forever, like his own dung; those who had seen him will ask, ‘Where is he?’

contentJson: [{"text":"He will fly away like a dream, never to be found;","poem":1},{"text":"he will be chased away like a vision in the night.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will fly away like a dream, never to be found; he will be chased away like a vision in the night.

contentJson: [{"text":"The eye that saw him will see him no more,","poem":1},{"text":"and his place will no longer behold him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The eye that saw him will see him no more, and his place will no longer behold him.

contentJson: [{"text":"His sons will seek the favor of the poor,","poem":1},{"text":"for his own hands must return his wealth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His sons will seek the favor of the poor, for his own hands must return his wealth.

contentJson: [{"text":"The youthful vigor that fills his bones","poem":1},{"text":"will lie down with him in the dust.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The youthful vigor that fills his bones will lie down with him in the dust.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though evil is sweet in his mouth","poem":1},{"text":"and he conceals it under his tongue,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though evil is sweet in his mouth and he conceals it under his tongue,

contentJson: [{"text":"though he cannot bear to let it go","poem":1},{"text":"and keeps it in his mouth,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: though he cannot bear to let it go and keeps it in his mouth,

contentJson: [{"text":"yet in his stomach his food sours","poem":1},{"text":"into the venom of cobras within him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: yet in his stomach his food sours into the venom of cobras within him.

contentJson: [{"text":"He swallows wealth but vomits it out;","poem":1},{"text":"God will force it from his stomach.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He swallows wealth but vomits it out; God will force it from his stomach.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will suck the poison of cobras;","poem":1},{"text":"the fangs of a viper will kill him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will suck the poison of cobras; the fangs of a viper will kill him.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will not enjoy the streams,","poem":1},{"text":"the rivers flowing with honey and cream.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will not enjoy the streams, the rivers flowing with honey and cream.

contentJson: [{"text":"He must return the fruit of his labor without consuming it;","poem":1},{"text":"he cannot enjoy the profits of his trading.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He must return the fruit of his labor without consuming it; he cannot enjoy the profits of his trading.

contentJson: [{"text":"For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor;","poem":1},{"text":"he has seized houses he did not build.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor; he has seized houses he did not build.

contentJson: [{"text":"Because his appetite is never satisfied,","poem":1},{"text":"he cannot escape with his treasure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Because his appetite is never satisfied, he cannot escape with his treasure.

contentJson: [{"text":"Nothing is left for him to consume;","poem":1},{"text":"thus his prosperity will not endure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Nothing is left for him to consume; thus his prosperity will not endure.

contentJson: [{"text":"In the midst of his plenty, he will be distressed;","poem":1},{"text":"the full force of misery will come upon him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In the midst of his plenty, he will be distressed; the full force of misery will come upon him.

contentJson: [{"text":"When he has filled his stomach,","poem":1},{"text":"God will vent His fury upon him,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"raining it down on him as he eats.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
When he has filled his stomach, God will vent His fury upon him, 
raining it down on him as he eats.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though he flees from an iron weapon,","poem":1},{"text":"a bronze-tipped arrow will pierce him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though he flees from an iron weapon, a bronze-tipped arrow will pierce him.

contentJson: [{"text":"It is drawn out of his back,","poem":1},{"text":"the gleaming point from his liver.","poem":2},{"noteId":28},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Terrors come over him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
It is drawn out of his back, the gleaming point from his liver. 
Terrors come over him.

contentJson: [{"text":"Total darkness is reserved for his treasures.","poem":1},{"text":"A fire unfanned will consume him","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and devour what is left in his tent.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Total darkness is reserved for his treasures. A fire unfanned will consume him 
and devour what is left in his tent.

contentJson: [{"text":"The heavens will expose his iniquity,","poem":1},{"text":"and the earth will rise up against him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The heavens will expose his iniquity, and the earth will rise up against him.

contentJson: [{"text":"The possessions of his house will be removed,","poem":1},{"text":"flowing away on the day of God’s wrath.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The possessions of his house will be removed, flowing away on the day of God’s wrath.

contentJson: [{"text":"This is the wicked man’s portion from God,","poem":1},{"text":"the inheritance God has appointed him.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: This is the wicked man’s portion from God, the inheritance God has appointed him.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Listen carefully to my words;","poem":1},{"text":"let this be your consolation to me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Listen carefully to my words; let this be your consolation to me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Bear with me while I speak;","poem":1},{"text":"then, after I have spoken, you may go on mocking.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Bear with me while I speak; then, after I have spoken, you may go on mocking.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is my complaint against a man?","poem":1},{"text":"Then why should I not be impatient?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is my complaint against a man? Then why should I not be impatient?

contentJson: [{"text":"Look at me and be appalled;","poem":1},{"text":"put your hand over your mouth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Look at me and be appalled; put your hand over your mouth.

contentJson: [{"text":"When I remember, terror takes hold,","poem":1},{"text":"and my body trembles in horror.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When I remember, terror takes hold, and my body trembles in horror.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why do the wicked live on,","poem":1},{"text":"growing old and increasing in power?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do the wicked live on, growing old and increasing in power?

contentJson: [{"text":"Their descendants are established around them,","poem":1},{"text":"and their offspring before their eyes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Their descendants are established around them, and their offspring before their eyes.

contentJson: [{"text":"Their homes are safe from fear;","poem":1},{"text":"no rod of punishment from God is upon them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Their homes are safe from fear; no rod of punishment from God is upon them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Their bulls breed without fail;","poem":1},{"text":"their cows bear calves and do not miscarry.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Their bulls breed without fail; their cows bear calves and do not miscarry.

contentJson: [{"text":"They send forth their little ones like a flock;","poem":1},{"text":"their children skip about,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They send forth their little ones like a flock; their children skip about,

contentJson: [{"text":"singing to the tambourine and lyre","poem":1},{"text":"and making merry at the sound of the flute.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: singing to the tambourine and lyre and making merry at the sound of the flute.

contentJson: [{"text":"They spend their days in prosperity","poem":1},{"text":"and go down to Sheol in peace.","poem":2},{"noteId":29}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They spend their days in prosperity and go down to Sheol in peace.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet they say to God: ‘Leave us alone!","poem":1},{"text":"For we have no desire to know Your ways.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet they say to God: ‘Leave us alone! For we have no desire to know Your ways.

contentJson: [{"text":"Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him,","poem":1},{"text":"and what would we gain if we pray to Him?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him, and what would we gain if we pray to Him?’

contentJson: [{"text":"Still, their prosperity is not in their own hands,","poem":1},{"text":"so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Still, their prosperity is not in their own hands, so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.

contentJson: [{"text":"How often is the lamp of the wicked put out?","poem":1},{"text":"Does disaster come upon them?","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Does God, in His anger, apportion destruction?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
How often is the lamp of the wicked put out? Does disaster come upon them? 
Does God, in His anger, apportion destruction?

contentJson: [{"text":"Are they like straw before the wind,","poem":1},{"text":"like chaff swept away by a storm?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Are they like straw before the wind, like chaff swept away by a storm?

contentJson: [{"text":"It is said that God lays up one’s punishment for his children.","poem":1},{"text":"Let God repay the man himself, so he will know it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It is said that God lays up one’s punishment for his children. Let God repay the man himself, so he will know it.

contentJson: [{"text":"Let his eyes see his own destruction;","poem":1},{"text":"let him drink for himself the wrath of the Almighty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Let his eyes see his own destruction; let him drink for himself the wrath of the Almighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"For what does he care about his household after him,","poem":1},{"text":"when the number of his months has run out?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For what does he care about his household after him, when the number of his months has run out?

contentJson: [{"text":"Can anyone teach knowledge to God,","poem":1},{"text":"since He judges those on high?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Can anyone teach knowledge to God, since He judges those on high?

contentJson: [{"text":"One man dies full of vigor,","poem":1},{"text":"completely secure and at ease.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: One man dies full of vigor, completely secure and at ease.

contentJson: [{"text":"His body is well nourished,","poem":1},{"noteId":30},{"text":"and his bones are rich with marrow.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His body is well nourished, and his bones are rich with marrow.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet another man dies in the bitterness of his soul,","poem":1},{"text":"having never tasted prosperity.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet another man dies in the bitterness of his soul, having never tasted prosperity.

contentJson: [{"text":"But together they lie down in the dust,","poem":1},{"text":"and worms cover them both.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But together they lie down in the dust, and worms cover them both.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, I know your thoughts full well,","poem":1},{"text":"the schemes by which you would wrong me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, I know your thoughts full well, the schemes by which you would wrong me.

contentJson: [{"text":"For you say, ‘Where now is the nobleman’s house,","poem":1},{"text":"and where are the tents in which the wicked dwell?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For you say, ‘Where now is the nobleman’s house, and where are the tents in which the wicked dwell?’

contentJson: [{"text":"Have you never asked those who travel the roads?","poem":1},{"text":"Do you not accept their reports?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Have you never asked those who travel the roads? Do you not accept their reports?

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, the evil man is spared from the day of calamity,","poem":1},{"text":"delivered from the day of wrath.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Indeed, the evil man is spared from the day of calamity, delivered from the day of wrath.

contentJson: [{"text":"Who denounces his behavior to his face?","poem":1},{"text":"Who repays him for what he has done?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Who denounces his behavior to his face? Who repays him for what he has done?

contentJson: [{"text":"He is carried to the grave,","poem":1},{"text":"and watch is kept over his tomb.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He is carried to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb.

contentJson: [{"text":"The clods of the valley are sweet to him;","poem":1},{"text":"everyone follows behind him,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and those before him are without number.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The clods of the valley are sweet to him; everyone follows behind him, 
and those before him are without number.

contentJson: [{"text":"So how can you comfort me with empty words?","poem":1},{"text":"For your answers remain full of falsehood.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So how can you comfort me with empty words? For your answers remain full of falsehood.”

contentJson: ["Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Can a man be of use to God?","poem":1},{"text":"Can even a wise man benefit Him?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Can a man be of use to God? Can even a wise man benefit Him?

contentJson: [{"text":"Does it delight the Almighty that you are righteous?","poem":1},{"text":"Does He profit if your ways are blameless?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does it delight the Almighty that you are righteous? Does He profit if your ways are blameless?

contentJson: [{"text":"Is it for your reverence that He rebukes you","poem":1},{"text":"and enters into judgment against you?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is it for your reverence that He rebukes you and enters into judgment against you?

contentJson: [{"text":"Is not your wickedness great?","poem":1},{"text":"Are not your iniquities endless?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is not your wickedness great? Are not your iniquities endless?

contentJson: [{"text":"For you needlessly demanded security from your brothers","poem":1},{"text":"and deprived the naked of their clothing.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For you needlessly demanded security from your brothers and deprived the naked of their clothing.

contentJson: [{"text":"You gave no water to the weary","poem":1},{"text":"and withheld food from the famished,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You gave no water to the weary and withheld food from the famished,

contentJson: [{"text":"while the land belonged to a mighty man,","poem":1},{"text":"and a man of honor lived on it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: while the land belonged to a mighty man, and a man of honor lived on it.

contentJson: [{"text":"You sent widows away empty-handed,","poem":1},{"text":"and the strength of the fatherless was crushed.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You sent widows away empty-handed, and the strength of the fatherless was crushed.

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore snares surround you,","poem":1},{"text":"and sudden peril terrifies you;","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Therefore snares surround you, and sudden peril terrifies you;

contentJson: [{"text":"it is so dark you cannot see,","poem":1},{"text":"and a flood of water covers you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: it is so dark you cannot see, and a flood of water covers you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Is not God as high as the heavens?","poem":1},{"text":"Look at the highest stars, how lofty they are!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Is not God as high as the heavens? Look at the highest stars, how lofty they are!

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet you say: ‘What does God know?","poem":1},{"text":"Does He judge through thick darkness?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet you say: ‘What does God know? Does He judge through thick darkness?

contentJson: [{"text":"Thick clouds veil Him so He does not see us","poem":1},{"text":"as He traverses the vault of heaven.","poem":2},{"noteId":31},{"text":"’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Thick clouds veil Him so He does not see us as He traverses the vault of heaven. ’

contentJson: [{"text":"Will you stay on the ancient path","poem":1},{"text":"that wicked men have trod?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will you stay on the ancient path that wicked men have trod?

contentJson: [{"text":"They were snatched away before their time,","poem":1},{"text":"and their foundations were swept away by a flood.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They were snatched away before their time, and their foundations were swept away by a flood.

contentJson: [{"text":"They said to God, ‘Depart from us.","poem":1},{"text":"What can the Almighty do to us?’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They said to God, ‘Depart from us. What can the Almighty do to us?’

contentJson: [{"text":"But it was He who filled their houses with good things;","poem":1},{"text":"so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But it was He who filled their houses with good things; so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.

contentJson: [{"text":"The righteous see it and are glad;","poem":1},{"text":"the innocent mock them:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The righteous see it and are glad; the innocent mock them:

contentJson: [{"text":"‘Surely our foes are destroyed,","poem":1},{"text":"and fire has consumed their excess.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: ‘Surely our foes are destroyed, and fire has consumed their excess.’

contentJson: [{"text":"Reconcile now and be at peace with Him;","poem":1},{"text":"thereby good will come to you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Reconcile now and be at peace with Him; thereby good will come to you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Receive instruction from His mouth,","poem":1},{"text":"and lay up His words in your heart.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Receive instruction from His mouth, and lay up His words in your heart.

contentJson: [{"text":"If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored.","poem":1},{"text":"If you remove injustice from your tents","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored. If you remove injustice from your tents

contentJson: [{"text":"and consign your gold to the dust","poem":1},{"text":"and the gold of Ophir to the stones of the ravines,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: and consign your gold to the dust and the gold of Ophir to the stones of the ravines,

contentJson: [{"text":"then the Almighty will be your gold","poem":1},{"text":"and the finest silver for you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then the Almighty will be your gold and the finest silver for you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely then you will delight in the Almighty","poem":1},{"text":"and lift up your face to God.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely then you will delight in the Almighty and lift up your face to God.

contentJson: [{"text":"You will pray to Him, and He will hear you,","poem":1},{"text":"and you will fulfill your vows.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You will pray to Him, and He will hear you, and you will fulfill your vows.

contentJson: [{"text":"Your decisions will be carried out,","poem":1},{"text":"and light will shine on your ways.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Your decisions will be carried out, and light will shine on your ways.

contentJson: [{"text":"When men are brought low and you say, ‘Lift them up!’","poem":1},{"text":"then He will save the lowly.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When men are brought low and you say, ‘Lift them up!’ then He will save the lowly.

contentJson: [{"text":"He will deliver even one who is not innocent,","poem":1},{"text":"rescuing him through the cleanness of your hands.”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He will deliver even one who is not innocent, rescuing him through the cleanness of your hands.”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Even today my complaint is bitter.","poem":1},{"text":"His hand is heavy despite my groaning.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Even today my complaint is bitter. His hand is heavy despite my groaning.

contentJson: [{"text":"If only I knew where to find Him,","poem":1},{"text":"so that I could go to His seat.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If only I knew where to find Him, so that I could go to His seat.

contentJson: [{"text":"I would plead my case before Him","poem":1},{"text":"and fill my mouth with arguments.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I would plead my case before Him and fill my mouth with arguments.

contentJson: [{"text":"I would learn how He would answer,","poem":1},{"text":"and consider what He would say.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I would learn how He would answer, and consider what He would say.

contentJson: [{"text":"Would He contend with me in His great power?","poem":1},{"text":"No, He would certainly take note of me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Would He contend with me in His great power? No, He would certainly take note of me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then an upright man could reason with Him,","poem":1},{"text":"and I would be delivered forever from my Judge.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then an upright man could reason with Him, and I would be delivered forever from my Judge.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I go east, He is not there,","poem":1},{"text":"and if I go west, I cannot find Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I go east, He is not there, and if I go west, I cannot find Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"When He is at work in the north, I cannot behold Him;","poem":1},{"text":"when He turns to the south, I cannot see Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When He is at work in the north, I cannot behold Him; when He turns to the south, I cannot see Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet He knows the way I have taken;","poem":1},{"text":"when He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet He knows the way I have taken; when He has tested me, I will come forth as gold.

contentJson: [{"text":"My feet have followed in His tracks;","poem":1},{"text":"I have kept His way without turning aside.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My feet have followed in His tracks; I have kept His way without turning aside.

contentJson: [{"text":"I have not departed from the command of His lips;","poem":1},{"text":"I have treasured the words of His mouth","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"more than my daily bread.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I have not departed from the command of His lips; I have treasured the words of His mouth 
more than my daily bread.

contentJson: [{"text":"But He is unchangeable, and who can oppose Him?","poem":1},{"text":"He does what He desires.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But He is unchangeable, and who can oppose Him? He does what He desires.

contentJson: [{"text":"For He carries out His decree against me,","poem":1},{"text":"and He has many such plans.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For He carries out His decree against me, and He has many such plans.

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore I am terrified in His presence;","poem":1},{"text":"when I consider this, I fear Him.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Therefore I am terrified in His presence; when I consider this, I fear Him.

contentJson: [{"text":"God has made my heart faint;","poem":1},{"text":"the Almighty has terrified me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: God has made my heart faint; the Almighty has terrified me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet I am not silenced by the darkness,","poem":1},{"text":"by the thick darkness that covers my face.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet I am not silenced by the darkness, by the thick darkness that covers my face.

contentJson: [{"text":"“Why does the Almighty not reserve times for judgment?","poem":1},{"text":"Why may those who know Him never see His days?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Why does the Almighty not reserve times for judgment? Why may those who know Him never see His days?

contentJson: [{"text":"Men move boundary stones;","poem":1},{"text":"they pasture stolen flocks.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Men move boundary stones; they pasture stolen flocks.

contentJson: [{"text":"They drive away the donkey of the fatherless","poem":1},{"text":"and take the widow’s ox in pledge.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They drive away the donkey of the fatherless and take the widow’s ox in pledge.

contentJson: [{"text":"They push the needy off the road","poem":1},{"text":"and force all the poor of the land into hiding.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They push the needy off the road and force all the poor of the land into hiding.

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, like wild donkeys in the desert,","poem":1},{"text":"the poor go to work foraging for food;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"the wasteland is food for their children.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Indeed, like wild donkeys in the desert, the poor go to work foraging for food; 
the wasteland is food for their children.

contentJson: [{"text":"They gather fodder in the fields","poem":1},{"text":"and glean the vineyards of the wicked.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They gather fodder in the fields and glean the vineyards of the wicked.

contentJson: [{"text":"Without clothing, they spend the night naked;","poem":1},{"text":"they have no covering against the cold.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Without clothing, they spend the night naked; they have no covering against the cold.

contentJson: [{"text":"Drenched by mountain rains,","poem":1},{"text":"they huddle against the rocks for want of shelter.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Drenched by mountain rains, they huddle against the rocks for want of shelter.

contentJson: [{"text":"The fatherless infant is snatched from the breast;","poem":1},{"text":"the nursing child of the poor is seized for a debt.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The fatherless infant is snatched from the breast; the nursing child of the poor is seized for a debt.

contentJson: [{"text":"Without clothing, they wander about naked.","poem":1},{"text":"They carry the sheaves, but still go hungry.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Without clothing, they wander about naked. They carry the sheaves, but still go hungry.

contentJson: [{"text":"They crush olives within their walls;","poem":1},{"text":"they tread the winepresses, but go thirsty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They crush olives within their walls; they tread the winepresses, but go thirsty.

contentJson: [{"text":"From the city, men groan,","poem":1},{"text":"and the souls of the wounded cry out,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"yet God charges no one with wrongdoing.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
From the city, men groan, and the souls of the wounded cry out, 
yet God charges no one with wrongdoing.

contentJson: [{"text":"Then there are those who rebel against the light,","poem":1},{"text":"not knowing its ways or staying on its paths.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then there are those who rebel against the light, not knowing its ways or staying on its paths.

contentJson: [{"text":"When daylight is gone, the murderer rises","poem":1},{"text":"to kill the poor and needy;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"in the night he is like a thief.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
When daylight is gone, the murderer rises to kill the poor and needy; 
in the night he is like a thief.

contentJson: [{"text":"The eye of the adulterer watches for twilight.","poem":1},{"text":"Thinking, ‘No eye will see me,’ he covers his face.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The eye of the adulterer watches for twilight. Thinking, ‘No eye will see me,’ he covers his face.

contentJson: [{"text":"In the dark they dig through houses;","poem":1},{"text":"by day they shut themselves in,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"never to experience the light.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
In the dark they dig through houses; by day they shut themselves in, 
never to experience the light.

contentJson: [{"text":"For to them, deep darkness is their morning;","poem":1},{"text":"surely they are friends with the terrors of darkness!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For to them, deep darkness is their morning; surely they are friends with the terrors of darkness!

contentJson: [{"text":"They are but foam on the surface of the water;","poem":1},{"text":"their portion of the land is cursed,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"so that no one turns toward their vineyards.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
They are but foam on the surface of the water; their portion of the land is cursed, 
so that no one turns toward their vineyards.

contentJson: [{"text":"As drought and heat consume the melting snow,","poem":1},{"text":"so Sheol steals those who have sinned.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: As drought and heat consume the melting snow, so Sheol steals those who have sinned.

contentJson: [{"text":"The womb forgets them;","poem":1},{"text":"the worm feeds on them;","poem":2},{"text":"they are remembered no more.","poem":1},{"text":"So injustice is like a broken tree.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The womb forgets them; the worm feeds on them; they are remembered no more. So injustice is like a broken tree.

contentJson: [{"text":"They prey on the barren and childless,","poem":1},{"text":"and show no kindness to the widow.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They prey on the barren and childless, and show no kindness to the widow.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet by His power, God drags away the mighty;","poem":1},{"text":"though rising up, they have no assurance of life.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet by His power, God drags away the mighty; though rising up, they have no assurance of life.

contentJson: [{"text":"He gives them a sense of security,","poem":1},{"text":"but His eyes are on their ways.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He gives them a sense of security, but His eyes are on their ways.

contentJson: [{"text":"They are exalted for a moment,","poem":1},{"text":"then they are gone;","poem":2},{"text":"they are brought low and gathered up like all others;","poem":1},{"text":"they are cut off like heads of grain.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They are exalted for a moment, then they are gone; they are brought low and gathered up like all others; they are cut off like heads of grain.

contentJson: [{"text":"If this is not so, then who can prove me a liar","poem":1},{"text":"and reduce my words to nothing?”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If this is not so, then who can prove me a liar and reduce my words to nothing?”

contentJson: ["Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Bildad the Shuhite replied:

contentJson: [{"text":"“Dominion and awe belong to God;","poem":1},{"text":"He establishes harmony in the heights of heaven.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Dominion and awe belong to God; He establishes harmony in the heights of heaven.

contentJson: [{"text":"Can His troops be numbered?","poem":1},{"text":"On whom does His light not rise?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not rise?

contentJson: [{"text":"How then can a man be just before God?","poem":1},{"text":"How can one born of woman be pure?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How then can a man be just before God? How can one born of woman be pure?

contentJson: [{"text":"If even the moon does not shine,","poem":1},{"text":"and the stars are not pure in His sight,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If even the moon does not shine, and the stars are not pure in His sight,

contentJson: [{"text":"how much less man, who is but a maggot,","poem":1},{"text":"and the son of man, who is but a worm!”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: how much less man, who is but a maggot, and the son of man, who is but a worm!”

contentJson: ["Then Job answered:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Then Job answered:

contentJson: [{"text":"“How you have helped the powerless","poem":1},{"text":"and saved the arm that is feeble!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “How you have helped the powerless and saved the arm that is feeble!

contentJson: [{"text":"How you have counseled the unwise","poem":1},{"text":"and provided fully sound insight!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: How you have counseled the unwise and provided fully sound insight!

contentJson: [{"text":"To whom have you uttered these words?","poem":1},{"text":"And whose spirit spoke through you?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: To whom have you uttered these words? And whose spirit spoke through you?

contentJson: [{"text":"The dead tremble—","poem":1},{"text":"those beneath the waters and those who dwell in them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The dead tremble— those beneath the waters and those who dwell in them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Sheol is naked before God,","poem":1},{"text":"and Abaddon","poem":2},{"noteId":32},{"text":"has no covering.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Sheol is naked before God, and Abaddon has no covering.

contentJson: [{"text":"He stretches out the north over empty space;","poem":1},{"text":"He hangs the earth upon nothing.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He stretches out the north over empty space; He hangs the earth upon nothing.

contentJson: [{"text":"He wraps up the waters in His clouds,","poem":1},{"text":"yet the clouds do not burst under their own weight.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He wraps up the waters in His clouds, yet the clouds do not burst under their own weight.

contentJson: [{"text":"He covers the face of the full moon,","poem":1},{"noteId":33},{"text":"spreading over it His cloud.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He covers the face of the full moon, spreading over it His cloud.

contentJson: [{"text":"He has inscribed a horizon on the face of the waters","poem":1},{"text":"at the boundary between light and darkness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He has inscribed a horizon on the face of the waters at the boundary between light and darkness.

contentJson: [{"text":"The foundations of heaven quake,","poem":1},{"text":"astounded at His rebuke.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The foundations of heaven quake, astounded at His rebuke.

contentJson: [{"text":"By His power He stirred","poem":1},{"noteId":34},{"text":"the sea;","poem":1},{"text":"by His understanding He shattered Rahab.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: By His power He stirred the sea; by His understanding He shattered Rahab.

contentJson: [{"text":"By His breath the skies were cleared;","poem":1},{"text":"His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.","poem":2},{"noteId":35}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: By His breath the skies were cleared; His hand pierced the fleeing serpent.

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, these are but the fringes of His ways;","poem":1},{"text":"how faint is the whisper we hear of Him!","poem":2},{"text":"Who then can understand","poem":1},{"text":"the thunder of His power?”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Indeed, these are but the fringes of His ways; how faint is the whisper we hear of Him! Who then can understand the thunder of His power?”

contentJson: ["Job continued his discourse:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Job continued his discourse:

contentJson: [{"text":"“As surely as God lives, who has deprived me of justice—","poem":1},{"text":"the Almighty, who has embittered my soul—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “As surely as God lives, who has deprived me of justice— the Almighty, who has embittered my soul—

contentJson: [{"text":"as long as my breath is still within me","poem":1},{"text":"and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: as long as my breath is still within me and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,

contentJson: [{"text":"my lips will not speak wickedness,","poem":1},{"text":"and my tongue will not utter deceit.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: my lips will not speak wickedness, and my tongue will not utter deceit.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will never say that you are right;","poem":1},{"text":"I will maintain my integrity until I die.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I will never say that you are right; I will maintain my integrity until I die.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will cling to my righteousness and never let go.","poem":1},{"text":"As long as I live, my conscience will not accuse me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I will cling to my righteousness and never let go. As long as I live, my conscience will not accuse me.

contentJson: [{"text":"May my enemy be like the wicked","poem":1},{"text":"and my opponent like the unjust.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: May my enemy be like the wicked and my opponent like the unjust.

contentJson: [{"text":"For what is the hope of the godless when he is cut off,","poem":1},{"text":"when God takes away his life?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For what is the hope of the godless when he is cut off, when God takes away his life?

contentJson: [{"text":"Will God hear his cry","poem":1},{"text":"when distress comes upon him?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will God hear his cry when distress comes upon him?

contentJson: [{"text":"Will he delight in the Almighty?","poem":1},{"text":"Will he call upon God at all times?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Will he delight in the Almighty? Will he call upon God at all times?

contentJson: [{"text":"I will instruct you in the power of God.","poem":1},{"text":"I will not conceal the ways of the Almighty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I will instruct you in the power of God. I will not conceal the ways of the Almighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely all of you have seen it for yourselves.","poem":1},{"text":"Why then do you keep up this empty talk?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely all of you have seen it for yourselves. Why then do you keep up this empty talk?

contentJson: [{"text":"This is the wicked man’s portion from God—","poem":1},{"text":"the heritage the ruthless receive from the Almighty.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: This is the wicked man’s portion from God— the heritage the ruthless receive from the Almighty.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword;","poem":1},{"text":"and his offspring will never have enough food.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
