text: Though his sons are many, they are destined for the sword; and his offspring will never have enough food.

contentJson: [{"text":"His survivors will be buried by the plague,","poem":1},{"text":"and their widows will not weep for them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His survivors will be buried by the plague, and their widows will not weep for them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Though he heaps up silver like dust","poem":1},{"text":"and piles up a wardrobe like clay,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Though he heaps up silver like dust and piles up a wardrobe like clay,

contentJson: [{"text":"what he lays up, the righteous will wear,","poem":1},{"text":"and his silver will be divided by the innocent.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: what he lays up, the righteous will wear, and his silver will be divided by the innocent.

contentJson: [{"text":"The house he built is like a moth’s cocoon,","poem":1},{"text":"like a hut set up by a watchman.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The house he built is like a moth’s cocoon, like a hut set up by a watchman.

contentJson: [{"text":"He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more;","poem":1},{"text":"when he opens his eyes, all is gone.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He lies down wealthy, but will do so no more; when he opens his eyes, all is gone.

contentJson: [{"text":"Terrors overtake him like a flood;","poem":1},{"text":"a tempest sweeps him away in the night.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Terrors overtake him like a flood; a tempest sweeps him away in the night.

contentJson: [{"text":"The east wind carries him away, and he is gone;","poem":1},{"text":"it sweeps him out of his place.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The east wind carries him away, and he is gone; it sweeps him out of his place.

contentJson: [{"text":"It hurls itself against him without mercy","poem":1},{"text":"as he flees headlong from its power.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It hurls itself against him without mercy as he flees headlong from its power.

contentJson: [{"text":"It claps its hands at him","poem":1},{"text":"and hisses him out of his place.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It claps its hands at him and hisses him out of his place.

contentJson: [{"text":"“Surely there is a mine for silver","poem":1},{"text":"and a place where gold is refined.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “Surely there is a mine for silver and a place where gold is refined.

contentJson: [{"text":"Iron is taken from the earth,","poem":1},{"text":"and copper is smelted from ore.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Iron is taken from the earth, and copper is smelted from ore.

contentJson: [{"text":"Man puts an end to the darkness;","poem":1},{"text":"he probes the farthest recesses","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"for ore in deepest darkness.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Man puts an end to the darkness; he probes the farthest recesses 
for ore in deepest darkness.

contentJson: [{"text":"Far from human habitation he cuts a shaft","poem":1},{"text":"in places forgotten by the foot of man.","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"Far from men he dangles and sways.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Far from human habitation he cuts a shaft in places forgotten by the foot of man. 
Far from men he dangles and sways.

contentJson: [{"text":"Food may come from the earth,","poem":1},{"text":"but from below it is transformed as by fire.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Food may come from the earth, but from below it is transformed as by fire.

contentJson: [{"text":"Its rocks are the source of sapphires,","poem":1},{"text":"containing flecks of gold.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Its rocks are the source of sapphires, containing flecks of gold.

contentJson: [{"text":"No bird of prey knows that path;","poem":1},{"text":"no falcon’s eye has seen it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: No bird of prey knows that path; no falcon’s eye has seen it.

contentJson: [{"text":"Proud beasts have never trodden it;","poem":1},{"text":"no lion has ever prowled over it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Proud beasts have never trodden it; no lion has ever prowled over it.

contentJson: [{"text":"The miner strikes the flint;","poem":1},{"text":"he overturns mountains at their base.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The miner strikes the flint; he overturns mountains at their base.

contentJson: [{"text":"He hews out channels in the rocks,","poem":1},{"text":"and his eyes spot every treasure.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He hews out channels in the rocks, and his eyes spot every treasure.

contentJson: [{"text":"He stops up","poem":1},{"noteId":36},{"text":"the sources of the streams","poem":1},{"text":"to bring what is hidden to light.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He stops up the sources of the streams to bring what is hidden to light.

contentJson: [{"text":"But where can wisdom be found,","poem":1},{"text":"and where does understanding dwell?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But where can wisdom be found, and where does understanding dwell?

contentJson: [{"text":"No man can know its value,","poem":1},{"text":"nor is it found in the land of the living.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: No man can know its value, nor is it found in the land of the living.

contentJson: [{"text":"The ocean depths say, ‘It is not in me,’","poem":1},{"text":"while the sea declares, ‘It is not with me.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The ocean depths say, ‘It is not in me,’ while the sea declares, ‘It is not with me.’

contentJson: [{"text":"It cannot be bought with gold,","poem":1},{"text":"nor can its price be weighed out in silver.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It cannot be bought with gold, nor can its price be weighed out in silver.

contentJson: [{"text":"It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir,","poem":1},{"text":"in precious onyx or sapphire.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It cannot be valued in the gold of Ophir, in precious onyx or sapphire.

contentJson: [{"text":"Neither gold nor crystal can compare to it,","poem":1},{"text":"nor jewels of fine gold be exchanged for it.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Neither gold nor crystal can compare to it, nor jewels of fine gold be exchanged for it.

contentJson: [{"text":"Coral and quartz are unworthy of mention;","poem":1},{"text":"the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Coral and quartz are unworthy of mention; the price of wisdom is beyond rubies.

contentJson: [{"text":"Topaz from Cush","poem":1},{"noteId":37},{"text":"cannot compare to it,","poem":1},{"text":"nor can it be valued in pure gold.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Topaz from Cush cannot compare to it, nor can it be valued in pure gold.

contentJson: [{"text":"From where then does wisdom come,","poem":1},{"text":"and where does understanding dwell?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: From where then does wisdom come, and where does understanding dwell?

contentJson: [{"text":"It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing","poem":1},{"text":"and concealed from the birds of the air.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It is hidden from the eyes of every living thing and concealed from the birds of the air.

contentJson: [{"text":"Abaddon","poem":1},{"noteId":38},{"text":"and Death say,","poem":1},{"text":"‘We have heard a rumor about it.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Abaddon and Death say, ‘We have heard a rumor about it.’

contentJson: [{"text":"But God understands its way,","poem":1},{"text":"and He knows its place.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But God understands its way, and He knows its place.

contentJson: [{"text":"For He looks to the ends of the earth","poem":1},{"text":"and sees everything under the heavens.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For He looks to the ends of the earth and sees everything under the heavens.

contentJson: [{"text":"When God fixed the weight of the wind","poem":1},{"text":"and measured out the waters,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When God fixed the weight of the wind and measured out the waters,

contentJson: [{"text":"when He set a limit for the rain","poem":1},{"text":"and a path for the thunderbolt,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when He set a limit for the rain and a path for the thunderbolt,

contentJson: [{"text":"then He looked at wisdom and appraised it;","poem":1},{"text":"He established it and searched it out.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then He looked at wisdom and appraised it; He established it and searched it out.

contentJson: [{"text":"And He said to man, ‘Behold,","poem":1},{"text":"the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
And He said to man, ‘Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom, 
and to turn away from evil is understanding.’”

contentJson: ["And Job continued his discourse:"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And Job continued his discourse:

contentJson: [{"text":"“How I long for the months gone by,","poem":1},{"text":"for the days when God watched over me,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “How I long for the months gone by, for the days when God watched over me,

contentJson: [{"text":"when His lamp shone above my head,","poem":1},{"text":"and by His light I walked through the darkness,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when His lamp shone above my head, and by His light I walked through the darkness,

contentJson: [{"text":"when I was in my prime,","poem":1},{"noteId":39},{"text":"when the friendship of God rested on my tent,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when I was in my prime, when the friendship of God rested on my tent,

contentJson: [{"text":"when the Almighty was still with me","poem":1},{"text":"and my children were around me,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when the Almighty was still with me and my children were around me,

contentJson: [{"text":"when my steps were bathed in cream","poem":1},{"text":"and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: when my steps were bathed in cream and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!

contentJson: [{"text":"When I went out to the city gate","poem":1},{"text":"and took my seat in the public square,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: When I went out to the city gate and took my seat in the public square,

contentJson: [{"text":"the young men saw me and withdrew,","poem":1},{"text":"and the old men rose to their feet.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: the young men saw me and withdrew, and the old men rose to their feet.

contentJson: [{"text":"The princes refrained from speaking","poem":1},{"text":"and covered their mouths with their hands.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The princes refrained from speaking and covered their mouths with their hands.

contentJson: [{"text":"The voices of the nobles were hushed,","poem":1},{"text":"and their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The voices of the nobles were hushed, and their tongues stuck to the roofs of their mouths.

contentJson: [{"text":"For those who heard me called me blessed,","poem":1},{"text":"and those who saw me commended me,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For those who heard me called me blessed, and those who saw me commended me,

contentJson: [{"text":"because I rescued the poor who cried out","poem":1},{"text":"and the fatherless who had no helper.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: because I rescued the poor who cried out and the fatherless who had no helper.

contentJson: [{"text":"The dying man blessed me,","poem":1},{"text":"and I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The dying man blessed me, and I made the widow’s heart sing for joy.

contentJson: [{"text":"I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;","poem":1},{"text":"justice was my robe and my turban.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me; justice was my robe and my turban.

contentJson: [{"text":"I served as eyes to the blind","poem":1},{"text":"and as feet to the lame.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I served as eyes to the blind and as feet to the lame.

contentJson: [{"text":"I was a father to the needy,","poem":1},{"text":"and I took up the case of the stranger.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I was a father to the needy, and I took up the case of the stranger.

contentJson: [{"text":"I shattered the fangs of the unjust","poem":1},{"text":"and snatched the prey from his teeth.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I shattered the fangs of the unjust and snatched the prey from his teeth.

contentJson: [{"text":"So I thought: ‘I will die in my nest","poem":1},{"text":"and multiply my days as the sand.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So I thought: ‘I will die in my nest and multiply my days as the sand.

contentJson: [{"text":"My roots will spread out to the waters,","poem":1},{"text":"and the dew will rest nightly on my branches.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My roots will spread out to the waters, and the dew will rest nightly on my branches.

contentJson: [{"text":"My glory is ever new within me,","poem":1},{"text":"and my bow is renewed in my hand.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My glory is ever new within me, and my bow is renewed in my hand.’

contentJson: [{"text":"Men listened to me with expectation,","poem":1},{"text":"waiting silently for my counsel.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Men listened to me with expectation, waiting silently for my counsel.

contentJson: [{"text":"After my words, they spoke no more;","poem":1},{"text":"my speech settled on them like dew.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: After my words, they spoke no more; my speech settled on them like dew.

contentJson: [{"text":"They waited for me as for rain","poem":1},{"text":"and drank in my words like spring showers.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They waited for me as for rain and drank in my words like spring showers.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I smiled at them, they did not believe it;","poem":1},{"text":"the light of my countenance was precious.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I smiled at them, they did not believe it; the light of my countenance was precious.

contentJson: [{"text":"I chose their course and presided as chief.","poem":1},{"text":"So I dwelt as a king among his troops,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"as a comforter of the mourners.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
I chose their course and presided as chief. So I dwelt as a king among his troops, 
as a comforter of the mourners.

contentJson: [{"text":"“But now they mock me,","poem":1},{"text":"men younger than I am,","poem":2},{"text":"whose fathers I would have refused","poem":1},{"text":"to entrust with my sheep dogs.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “But now they mock me, men younger than I am, whose fathers I would have refused to entrust with my sheep dogs.

contentJson: [{"text":"What use to me was the strength of their hands,","poem":1},{"text":"since their vigor had left them?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: What use to me was the strength of their hands, since their vigor had left them?

contentJson: [{"text":"Gaunt from poverty and hunger,","poem":1},{"text":"they gnawed the dry land,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and the desolate wasteland by night.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Gaunt from poverty and hunger, they gnawed the dry land, 
and the desolate wasteland by night.

contentJson: [{"text":"They plucked mallow among the shrubs,","poem":1},{"text":"and the roots of the broom tree were their food.","poem":2},{"noteId":40}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They plucked mallow among the shrubs, and the roots of the broom tree were their food.

contentJson: [{"text":"They were banished from among men,","poem":1},{"text":"shouted down like thieves,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They were banished from among men, shouted down like thieves,

contentJson: [{"text":"so that they lived on the slopes of the wadis,","poem":1},{"text":"among the rocks and in holes in the ground.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: so that they lived on the slopes of the wadis, among the rocks and in holes in the ground.

contentJson: [{"text":"They cried out among the shrubs","poem":1},{"text":"and huddled beneath the nettles.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They cried out among the shrubs and huddled beneath the nettles.

contentJson: [{"text":"A senseless and nameless brood,","poem":1},{"text":"they were driven off the land.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A senseless and nameless brood, they were driven off the land.

contentJson: [{"text":"And now they mock me in song;","poem":1},{"text":"I have become a byword among them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And now they mock me in song; I have become a byword among them.

contentJson: [{"text":"They abhor me and keep far from me;","poem":1},{"text":"they do not hesitate to spit in my face.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They abhor me and keep far from me; they do not hesitate to spit in my face.

contentJson: [{"text":"Because God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me,","poem":1},{"text":"they have cast off restraint","poem":2},{"noteId":41},{"text":"in my presence.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Because God has unstrung my bow and afflicted me, they have cast off restraint in my presence.

contentJson: [{"text":"The rabble arises at my right;","poem":1},{"text":"they lay snares for my feet","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and build siege ramps against me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
The rabble arises at my right; they lay snares for my feet 
and build siege ramps against me.

contentJson: [{"text":"They tear up my path;","poem":1},{"text":"they profit from my destruction,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"with no one to restrain them.","poem":2},{"noteId":42}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
They tear up my path; they profit from my destruction, 
with no one to restrain them.

contentJson: [{"text":"They advance as through a wide breach;","poem":1},{"text":"through the ruins they keep rolling in.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: They advance as through a wide breach; through the ruins they keep rolling in.

contentJson: [{"text":"Terrors are turned loose against me;","poem":1},{"text":"they drive away my dignity as by the wind,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"and my prosperity has passed like a cloud.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
Terrors are turned loose against me; they drive away my dignity as by the wind, 
and my prosperity has passed like a cloud.

contentJson: [{"text":"And now my soul is poured out within me;","poem":1},{"text":"days of affliction grip me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: And now my soul is poured out within me; days of affliction grip me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Night pierces my bones,","poem":1},{"text":"and my gnawing pains never rest.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Night pierces my bones, and my gnawing pains never rest.

contentJson: [{"text":"With great force He grasps my garment;","poem":1},{"noteId":43},{"text":"He seizes me by the collar of my tunic.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: With great force He grasps my garment; He seizes me by the collar of my tunic.

contentJson: [{"text":"He throws me into the mud,","poem":1},{"text":"and I have become like dust and ashes.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He throws me into the mud, and I have become like dust and ashes.

contentJson: [{"text":"I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer;","poem":1},{"text":"when I stand up, You merely look at me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I cry out to You for help, but You do not answer; when I stand up, You merely look at me.

contentJson: [{"text":"You have ruthlessly turned on me;","poem":1},{"text":"You oppose me with Your strong hand.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: You have ruthlessly turned on me; You oppose me with Your strong hand.

contentJson: [{"text":"You snatch me up into the wind","poem":1},{"text":"and drive me before it;","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"You toss me about","poem":2},{"noteId":44},{"text":"in the storm.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
You snatch me up into the wind and drive me before it; 
You toss me about in the storm.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yes, I know that You will bring me down to death,","poem":1},{"text":"to the place appointed for all the living.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yes, I know that You will bring me down to death, to the place appointed for all the living.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet no one stretches out his hand to a ruined man","poem":1},{"text":"when he cries for help in his distress.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet no one stretches out his hand to a ruined man when he cries for help in his distress.

contentJson: [{"text":"Have I not wept for those in trouble?","poem":1},{"text":"Has my soul not grieved for the needy?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Have I not wept for those in trouble? Has my soul not grieved for the needy?

contentJson: [{"text":"But when I hoped for good, evil came;","poem":1},{"text":"when I looked for light, darkness fell.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But when I hoped for good, evil came; when I looked for light, darkness fell.

contentJson: [{"text":"I am churning within and cannot rest;","poem":1},{"text":"days of affliction confront me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I am churning within and cannot rest; days of affliction confront me.

contentJson: [{"text":"I go about blackened, but not by the sun.","poem":1},{"text":"I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I go about blackened, but not by the sun. I stand up in the assembly and cry for help.

contentJson: [{"text":"I have become a brother of jackals,","poem":1},{"noteId":45},{"text":"a companion of ostriches.","poem":2},{"noteId":46}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have become a brother of jackals, a companion of ostriches.

contentJson: [{"text":"My skin grows black and peels,","poem":1},{"text":"and my bones burn with fever.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My skin grows black and peels, and my bones burn with fever.

contentJson: [{"text":"My harp is tuned to mourning","poem":1},{"text":"and my flute to the sound of weeping.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My harp is tuned to mourning and my flute to the sound of weeping.

contentJson: [{"text":"“I have made a covenant with my eyes.","poem":1},{"text":"How then could I gaze with desire at a virgin?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “I have made a covenant with my eyes. How then could I gaze with desire at a virgin?

contentJson: [{"text":"For what is the allotment of God from above,","poem":1},{"text":"or the heritage from the Almighty on high?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For what is the allotment of God from above, or the heritage from the Almighty on high?

contentJson: [{"text":"Does not disaster come to the unjust","poem":1},{"text":"and calamity to the workers of iniquity?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does not disaster come to the unjust and calamity to the workers of iniquity?

contentJson: [{"text":"Does He not see my ways","poem":1},{"text":"and count my every step?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Does He not see my ways and count my every step?

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have walked in falsehood","poem":1},{"text":"or my foot has rushed to deceit,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have walked in falsehood or my foot has rushed to deceit,

contentJson: [{"text":"let God weigh me with honest scales,","poem":1},{"text":"that He may know my integrity.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: let God weigh me with honest scales, that He may know my integrity.

contentJson: [{"text":"If my steps have turned from the path,","poem":1},{"text":"if my heart has followed my eyes,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"or if impurity has stuck to my hands,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
If my steps have turned from the path, if my heart has followed my eyes, 
or if impurity has stuck to my hands,

contentJson: [{"text":"then may another eat what I have sown,","poem":1},{"text":"and may my crops be uprooted.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then may another eat what I have sown, and may my crops be uprooted.

contentJson: [{"text":"If my heart has been enticed by my neighbor’s wife,","poem":1},{"text":"or I have lurked at his door,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If my heart has been enticed by my neighbor’s wife, or I have lurked at his door,

contentJson: [{"text":"then may my own wife grind grain for another,","poem":1},{"text":"and may other men sleep with her.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then may my own wife grind grain for another, and may other men sleep with her.

contentJson: [{"text":"For that would be a heinous crime,","poem":1},{"text":"an iniquity to be judged.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For that would be a heinous crime, an iniquity to be judged.

contentJson: [{"text":"For it is a fire that burns down to Abaddon;","poem":1},{"noteId":47},{"text":"it would root out my entire harvest.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For it is a fire that burns down to Abaddon; it would root out my entire harvest.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have rejected the cause of my manservant or maidservant","poem":1},{"text":"when they made a complaint against me,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have rejected the cause of my manservant or maidservant when they made a complaint against me,

contentJson: [{"text":"what will I do when God rises to judge?","poem":1},{"text":"How will I answer when called to account?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: what will I do when God rises to judge? How will I answer when called to account?

contentJson: [{"text":"Did not He who made me in the womb also make them?","poem":1},{"text":"Did not the same One form us in the womb?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Did not He who made me in the womb also make them? Did not the same One form us in the womb?

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have denied the desires of the poor","poem":1},{"text":"or allowed the widow’s eyes to fail,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have denied the desires of the poor or allowed the widow’s eyes to fail,

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have eaten my morsel alone,","poem":1},{"text":"not sharing it with the fatherless—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have eaten my morsel alone, not sharing it with the fatherless—

contentJson: [{"text":"though from my youth I reared him as would a father,","poem":1},{"text":"and from my mother’s womb I guided the widow—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: though from my youth I reared him as would a father, and from my mother’s womb I guided the widow—

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have seen one perish for lack of clothing,","poem":1},{"text":"or a needy man without a cloak,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have seen one perish for lack of clothing, or a needy man without a cloak,

contentJson: [{"text":"if his heart has not blessed me","poem":1},{"noteId":48},{"text":"for warming him with the fleece of my sheep,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if his heart has not blessed me for warming him with the fleece of my sheep,

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless","poem":1},{"text":"because I saw that I had support in the gate,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless because I saw that I had support in the gate,

contentJson: [{"text":"then may my arm fall from my shoulder","poem":1},{"text":"and be torn from its socket.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: then may my arm fall from my shoulder and be torn from its socket.

contentJson: [{"text":"For calamity from God terrifies me,","poem":1},{"text":"and His splendor I cannot overpower.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For calamity from God terrifies me, and His splendor I cannot overpower.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have put my trust in gold","poem":1},{"text":"or called pure gold my security,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have put my trust in gold or called pure gold my security,

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have rejoiced in my great wealth","poem":1},{"text":"because my hand had gained so much,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have rejoiced in my great wealth because my hand had gained so much,

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have beheld the sun","poem":1},{"noteId":49},{"text":"in its radiance","poem":1},{"text":"or the moon moving in splendor,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have beheld the sun in its radiance or the moon moving in splendor,

contentJson: [{"text":"so that my heart was secretly enticed","poem":1},{"text":"and my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: so that my heart was secretly enticed and my hand threw a kiss from my mouth,

contentJson: [{"text":"this would also be an iniquity to be judged,","poem":1},{"text":"for I would have denied God on high.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: this would also be an iniquity to be judged, for I would have denied God on high.

contentJson: [{"text":"If I have rejoiced in my enemy’s ruin,","poem":1},{"text":"or exulted when evil befell him—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: If I have rejoiced in my enemy’s ruin, or exulted when evil befell him—

contentJson: [{"text":"I have not allowed my mouth to sin","poem":1},{"text":"by asking for his life with a curse—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I have not allowed my mouth to sin by asking for his life with a curse—

contentJson: [{"text":"if the men of my house have not said,","poem":1},{"text":"‘Who is there who has not had his fill?’—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if the men of my house have not said, ‘Who is there who has not had his fill?’—

name: Berean Standard Bible
text: but no stranger had to lodge on the street, for my door has been open to the traveler—

name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have covered my transgressions like Adam by hiding my guilt in my heart,

text: because I greatly feared the crowds and the contempt of the clans terrified me, so that I kept silent and would not go outside—

name: Berean Standard Bible
text: (Oh, that I had one to hear me! Here is my signature. Let the Almighty answer me; let my accuser compose an indictment.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely I would carry it on my shoulder","poem":1},{"text":"and wear it like a crown.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely I would carry it on my shoulder and wear it like a crown.

contentJson: [{"text":"I would give account of all my steps;","poem":1},{"text":"I would approach Him like a prince.)—","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I would give account of all my steps; I would approach Him like a prince.)—

contentJson: [{"text":"if my land cries out against me","poem":1},{"text":"and its furrows weep together,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if my land cries out against me and its furrows weep together,

contentJson: [{"text":"if I have devoured its produce without payment","poem":1},{"text":"or broken the spirit of its tenants,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: if I have devoured its produce without payment or broken the spirit of its tenants,

contentJson: [{"text":"then let briers grow instead of wheat","poem":1},{"text":"and stinkweed instead of barley.”","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},"Thus conclude the words of Job."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
then let briers grow instead of wheat and stinkweed instead of barley.” 
Thus conclude the words of Job.

contentJson: ["So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So these three men stopped answering Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

contentJson: ["This kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram. He burned with anger against Job for justifying himself rather than God,"]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: This kindled the anger of Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram. He burned with anger against Job for justifying himself rather than God,

contentJson: ["and he burned with anger against Job’s three friends because they had failed to refute Job, and yet had condemned him."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: and he burned with anger against Job’s three friends because they had failed to refute Job, and yet had condemned him.

contentJson: ["Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the others were older than he."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Now Elihu had waited to speak to Job because the others were older than he.

contentJson: ["But when he saw that the three men had no further reply, his anger was kindled."]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But when he saw that the three men had no further reply, his anger was kindled.

contentJson: ["So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite declared:",{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"“I am young in years,","poem":1},{"text":"while you are old;","poem":2},{"text":"that is why I was timid and afraid","poem":1},{"text":"to tell you what I know.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
So Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite declared: 
“I am young in years, while you are old; that is why I was timid and afraid to tell you what I know.

contentJson: [{"text":"I thought that age should speak,","poem":1},{"text":"and many years should teach wisdom.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I thought that age should speak, and many years should teach wisdom.

contentJson: [{"text":"But there is a spirit","poem":1},{"noteId":51},{"text":"in a man,","poem":1},{"text":"the breath of the Almighty,","poem":2},{"lineBreak":true},{"text":"that gives him understanding.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text:
But there is a spirit in a man, the breath of the Almighty, 
that gives him understanding.

contentJson: [{"text":"It is not only the old","poem":1},{"noteId":52},{"text":"who are wise,","poem":1},{"text":"or the elderly who understand justice.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: It is not only the old who are wise, or the elderly who understand justice.

contentJson: [{"text":"Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me;","poem":1},{"text":"I too will declare what I know.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Therefore I say, ‘Listen to me; I too will declare what I know.’

contentJson: [{"text":"Indeed, I waited while you spoke;","poem":1},{"text":"I listened to your reasoning;","poem":2},{"text":"as you searched for words,","poem":1}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Indeed, I waited while you spoke; I listened to your reasoning; as you searched for words,

contentJson: [{"text":"I paid you full attention.","poem":2},{"text":"But no one proved Job wrong;","poem":1},{"text":"not one of you rebutted his arguments.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I paid you full attention. But no one proved Job wrong; not one of you rebutted his arguments.

contentJson: [{"text":"So do not claim, ‘We have found wisdom;","poem":1},{"text":"let God, not man, refute him.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: So do not claim, ‘We have found wisdom; let God, not man, refute him.’

contentJson: [{"text":"But Job has not directed his words against me,","poem":1},{"text":"and I will not answer him with your arguments.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: But Job has not directed his words against me, and I will not answer him with your arguments.

contentJson: [{"text":"Job’s friends are dismayed, with no more to say;","poem":1},{"text":"words have escaped them.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Job’s friends are dismayed, with no more to say; words have escaped them.

contentJson: [{"text":"Must I wait, now that they are silent,","poem":1},{"text":"now that they stand and no longer reply?","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Must I wait, now that they are silent, now that they stand and no longer reply?

contentJson: [{"text":"I too will answer;","poem":1},{"text":"yes, I will declare what I know.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I too will answer; yes, I will declare what I know.

contentJson: [{"text":"For I am full of words,","poem":1},{"text":"and my spirit within me compels me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For I am full of words, and my spirit within me compels me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, my belly is like unvented wine;","poem":1},{"text":"it is about to burst like a new wineskin.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, my belly is like unvented wine; it is about to burst like a new wineskin.

contentJson: [{"text":"I must speak and find relief;","poem":1},{"text":"I must open my lips and respond.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I must speak and find relief; I must open my lips and respond.

contentJson: [{"text":"I will be partial to no one,","poem":1},{"text":"nor will I flatter any man.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I will be partial to no one, nor will I flatter any man.

contentJson: [{"text":"For I do not know how to flatter,","poem":1},{"text":"or my Maker would remove me in an instant.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For I do not know how to flatter, or my Maker would remove me in an instant.

contentJson: [{"text":"“But now, O Job, hear my speech,","poem":1},{"text":"and listen to all my words.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: “But now, O Job, hear my speech, and listen to all my words.

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, I will open my mouth;","poem":1},{"text":"my address is on the tip of my tongue.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, I will open my mouth; my address is on the tip of my tongue.

contentJson: [{"text":"My words are from an upright heart,","poem":1},{"text":"and my lips speak sincerely what I know.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: My words are from an upright heart, and my lips speak sincerely what I know.

contentJson: [{"text":"The Spirit of God has made me,","poem":1},{"text":"and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: The Spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.

contentJson: [{"text":"Refute me if you can;","poem":1},{"text":"prepare your case and confront me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Refute me if you can; prepare your case and confront me.

contentJson: [{"text":"I am just like you before God;","poem":1},{"text":"I was also formed from clay.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: I am just like you before God; I was also formed from clay.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely no fear of me should terrify you;","poem":1},{"text":"nor will my hand be heavy upon you.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely no fear of me should terrify you; nor will my hand be heavy upon you.

contentJson: [{"text":"Surely you have spoken in my hearing,","poem":1},{"text":"and I have heard these very words:","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Surely you have spoken in my hearing, and I have heard these very words:

contentJson: [{"text":"‘I am pure, without transgression;","poem":1},{"text":"I am clean, with no iniquity in me.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: ‘I am pure, without transgression; I am clean, with no iniquity in me.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet God finds occasions against me;","poem":1},{"text":"He counts me as His enemy.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet God finds occasions against me; He counts me as His enemy.

contentJson: [{"text":"He puts my feet in the stocks;","poem":1},{"text":"He watches over all my paths.’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He puts my feet in the stocks; He watches over all my paths.’

contentJson: [{"text":"Behold, you are not right in this matter.","poem":1},{"text":"I will answer you, for God is greater than man.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Behold, you are not right in this matter. I will answer you, for God is greater than man.

contentJson: [{"text":"Why do you complain to Him","poem":1},{"text":"that He answers nothing a man asks?","poem":2},{"noteId":53}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Why do you complain to Him that He answers nothing a man asks?

contentJson: [{"text":"For God speaks in one way and in another,","poem":1},{"text":"yet no one notices.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: For God speaks in one way and in another, yet no one notices.

contentJson: [{"text":"In a dream,","poem":1},{"text":"in a vision in the night,","poem":2},{"text":"when deep sleep falls upon men","poem":1},{"text":"as they slumber on their beds,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: In a dream, in a vision in the night, when deep sleep falls upon men as they slumber on their beds,

contentJson: [{"text":"He opens their ears","poem":1},{"text":"and terrifies them with warnings","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He opens their ears and terrifies them with warnings

contentJson: [{"text":"to turn a man from wrongdoing","poem":1},{"text":"and keep him from pride,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: to turn a man from wrongdoing and keep him from pride,

contentJson: [{"text":"to preserve his soul from the Pit","poem":1},{"text":"and his life from perishing by the sword.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: to preserve his soul from the Pit and his life from perishing by the sword.

contentJson: [{"text":"A man is also chastened on his bed","poem":1},{"text":"with pain and constant distress in his bones,","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: A man is also chastened on his bed with pain and constant distress in his bones,

contentJson: [{"text":"so that he detests his bread,","poem":1},{"text":"and his soul loathes his favorite food.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: so that he detests his bread, and his soul loathes his favorite food.

contentJson: [{"text":"His flesh wastes away from sight,","poem":1},{"text":"and his hidden bones protrude.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: His flesh wastes away from sight, and his hidden bones protrude.

contentJson: [{"text":"He draws near to the Pit,","poem":1},{"text":"and his life to the messengers of death.","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: He draws near to the Pit, and his life to the messengers of death.

contentJson: [{"text":"Yet if there is a messenger on his side,","poem":1},{"text":"one mediator in a thousand,","poem":2},{"text":"to tell a man what is right for him,","poem":1}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: Yet if there is a messenger on his side, one mediator in a thousand, to tell a man what is right for him,

contentJson: [{"text":"to be gracious to him and say,","poem":2},{"text":"‘Spare him from going down to the Pit;","poem":1},{"text":"I have found his ransom,’","poem":2}]
name: Berean Standard Bible
text: to be gracious to him and say, ‘Spare him from going down to the Pit; I have found his ransom,’
